Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Ibis!! HORRIBLE.”
Reviews.Author: Emarney
Reviews.Content: The room was horrible. No block out curtains sunlight beemed into the room (We had to hang up a blanket on the window). Tiny room and bathroom. No lock on bathroom door, zero privacy. Could here people walking around above us and everytime someone had a shower it made a horrid noise (We literally did not sleep for 2 nights - i purchased the 3night deal off Wot if site and i requested to check out after 2 nights of a total nightmare, sleep deprived and feeling sick - Ibis refused to give me a refund due to being purchased on Wot if)..If you had the air on on at night you froze to death, if you didnt have the air con on you would boil. Bed very uncomfortable and moved everytime you touch it/rolled over. When i got home i checked my bank balance and saw a $55 pending transaction on my account - i rang my bank and they informed me this was Ibis (Which i had NOT been told about when handing my card over at check in) Very unprofessional and horrible experience. Still waiting for mangaer to contact me re possible refund but i hightly doubt it. I advise you not to stay at the ibis, Park royal darling harbour recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Kiran575
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located next to the wharf, monorail and harbour side mall. Rooms are a bit small but the view from the harbour side room is awesome. But surprised that they gave toiletaries and cleaning done in the morning. The staff were friendly and helpful. Pleasantly surprised. The hotel is comfortable with basic amenities and good for people who aren't spending a lot of time in the room. But because of the location we could come back to room to drop shopping or put feet up.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Ibis”
Reviews.Author: AverageGirl
Reviews.Content: I don't like this hotel at all. I've stayed several times now on business trips and only went back because of the convenient location and lack of availability in other places. The rooms are small and the walls are paper thin. You hear everything going on next door and in the hallways. The beds are uncomfortable and the pillows are all paper thin. What's even worse is that the beds are on wheels so if you try and sit up and read in bed you lean against the wall (there's no behead!) and the bed slides out from under you - ridiculous! The showers are cracked and mouldy. Some of the rooms are so hot because the air-conditioning doesn't work too well. There's no mini bar in your room. There's no room service for meals. I went down to the restaurant for dinner and was told that they were only serving meals at the bar, however I could then carry my meal and sit at a table in the restaurant! There's not much choice food wise - a burger or a pizza. Shop around for a better hotel and leave the Ibis alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: jane b
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better position, ok it's a budget hotel, but its clean, you have everything you want, right on Darling Harbour, with a walkway to the monorail, and one to the Harbourside shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ideal room, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Lina R
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff very friendly but a shame for the size of the rooms and the discomfort of the pillows. Price was too experience for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible except for the location”
Reviews.Author: Ros W
Reviews.Content: If you are just looking for a good location, then stay there but if you are looking for a good night's sleep and a bit of comfort, don't touch it with a ten foot pole. My company was charged $330 for my room - daylight robbery - when the last time I stayed in Sydney, it cost $250 at the Radisson for a stunning room. Firstly, the rooms do not have curtains, they have horrible rattan-type blind things that look like they've been pulled out of someone's garden shed. The night light pours in so the room never gets sufficiently dark. The duvet on the bed was a threadbare excuse for one and in the cupboard was a hard old-fashioned blanket that could have been my Grandmothers. I had to try and choose between hanging the blanket over the blinds to block out the light or put it on top of the duvet to keep me confortable. In the end I chose the bed and spent the night trying to sleep in semi-darkness. Over and above this you can hear everything that goes on in the corridors, which incidentally are a horrible, dark, purple/brown colour and the room doors deep red. There is no room service and the 'restaurant' downstairs closes at 9pm. You can order a meal from a choice of 4 or 5 items from their 'grab and go' menu, which means you order it and then they phone you when it is ready so you can go and pick it up at reception. You be the judge.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: WillTraveloften
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I was concerned that it wasn't going to be conveniently situated. However, access from the back - which overlooks Darling Harbour, offers a fifteen minute walk to the ferrys, five minutes from fromn a nuber of good eateries, five minutes from the Maritime Museum and if you're there near the Chines New Year, superb views of the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “The tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: Damanda-aus
Reviews.Content: For the price, pop across the Harbour and stay at a 5* in the city and enjoy the walk. The rooms make you feel like you should be selling vaccuums in the 60's - small, depressing, and the bed is IBISymal.

Reviews.Title: “Great ! Modern comfortable room overlooking Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: rosetta b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great ! The room had modern facilities (including a very comfortable new bed) . I loved the peaceful view over Darling Harbour especially the lights at night. The staff were all helpful and friendly. Hotel was easy walking from the Harbourside Monorail station, so very convenient to travel around city of Sydney from hotel. If you have booked to see a show at Sydney Lyric this hotel is walking distance from 'The Star ' area.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, but fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: Thenewlyweds09
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Sydney convention centre and booked this hotel because it was so close by and quite a bit cheaper than the other hotels around the harbour. To be honest the room was on the small side and the hotel is nothing fancy at all and In places it's a tad run down However the bed was very comfortable, it was spotlessly clean and the location is great. Without a doubt the only stand out thing is the view of Darling harbour which was just beautiful at night. I recommend if you're going to book this hotel go for a "room with a view" if you can as it was not much extra and worth it to make a very forgettable hotel a little bit memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting Darling Harbour & Chinatown.Spotlessly clean room but small. Chose to stay here rather than the more expensive Novotel next door, happy that I did. Cheaper parking as well. Would be happy to book into this hotel again. Good value for money compared with other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: fluffybinks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights while attending a conference at the nearby convention and exhibition centre. The good points of this hotel are the proximity to the conference centre and Darling Harbour with the many bars, restaurants etc and pleasant views. A short walk to the Sydney CBD too. This is where the good ends. The staff were also quite friendly and attentive. The hotel seems to charge a WAY TO HIGH cost per night considering the style of hotel it is, if it was cheaper then i would rate the hotel higher. I know Sydney is an expensive city, but while I was in the hotel I found a couple of better places nearby with similar rates - including a huge serviced apartment! Too bad my room was prepaid. Here is the low down: The rooms are tiny, this is quite normal for Ibis but for this price you expect a bit more in width as you could barely get past the bed. The only space for your bag - and it better not be a suitcase as it would not fit is the built in pseudo "seat". The mattress is one of the most uncomfortable mattresses ever. it needs replacing. There are two pillows, one hard as a rock and the other flat as a pancake. There is no duvet- it is a sort of "mattress protector like" material stuffed inside the sheet - cheap and nasty, you are cold at night if the aircon is on, if you leave the aircon off you can't breath as its too stuffy. There is a dusty blanket on top of the "cupboard" - but who wants to use that. Needless to say my sleep quality was poor, I had trouble sleeping every night (see also "noise" below). The "cupboard" is really a space near the window about 25 -30 cm wide where you can hang your clothes - NO DRAWERS anywhere - they could easily fit under the built in desk by the window - i hate not having drawers, there is no where to put your stuff. The bathroom although small is adequate, it has lots of shelf space but there is a stand alone sink with no space around it when they could have put in a small bench. My toilet cistern was not working properly, I had to keep fixing it by opening the back. I think the worse thing of all is the paper-like quality of the walls - you can hear it very loud when someone above or to the side of you has a shower, watches TV or coughs. You can hear it really loudly when people walk down the hallway. Oh yes - the cleaners - they begin cleaning by 7.30 -8.00 am - they don't care that guests might be sleeping - they bang doors, the vacuum cleaner on the walls, they talk loud.... and they bang on your door if you don't have your do not disturb sign up, and since there is no chain on the door, you freak out they might come in so get up anyway. But you can't sleep anyway if the racket is going on outside. The internet charges are ridiculous! I "thought" I was signing up for 24 hours to use as I like over my stay for $24. But this was only 24 hours full stop. What a rip off! I had to hire a locker to store my luggage after checkout for $7. It was so cheap and nasty - yet it was not cheap as I paid! Never seen this before in a hotel. It leaves a nasty feeling inside. I never had breakfast here - why should i when there is no view... I took the short walk to Darling Harbour and dined by the seaside every morning. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: adalbore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic not offering anything but a barebone small room. Rooms does not have even space where to put an open suitcase (I had to put mine on the bed), there is no shower soap (this is crazy!) and they don't even offer a plain bottle of water. In my room there was a window curtain broken but the most crazy things is how they charge internet access. I download few videos worth about 300Mb of data and they charged me the equivalent of one hundred euro. Needless to say that I immediately check-out from that trap. would not recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanandjohn51
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Hotel Ibis for four nights during our stay in Australia at the end of February. The hotel is in a great location for all the amenities of the Darling Harbour. We were a bit disappointed at the size of the room, it was very much like a room in a Premier Inn or Travelodge and we had expected more for our money. Saying that though, it was clean and the bed was comfy. We were also shocked at having to pay for leaving our suitcases when we checked out until our transfer arrived, whereas other hotels we stayed in looked after them free of charge. All-in-all we enjoyed our stay in Sydney but may look for another hotel to stay in if we return again.

Reviews.Title: “not what was expected”
Reviews.Author: naebadsofar Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As the title says not what was expected, not for price paid. The location was ok, but not the standard I expected a lot more for the price I paid. The food very plain and did not do the hotel any favours as the staff looked unhappy to serve you, but they were helpful when asked and could not fault that but only when ask they helped but they had to be asked as the offer was not there. As I said not what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: FDSDarwin
Reviews.Content: Location was good- 5 minutes walk from the convention centre where I was attending a conference. Average other than that; room was very old and shabby. Service was mixed. Breakfast buffet was solid but not great. Recommended for business travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A bit small”
Reviews.Author: lee858
Reviews.Content: Small room wonderful view great location had a wonderful stay though

Reviews.Title: “Small room but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BVBV
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days while I was working in Sydney and found the room quite adequate for one person. With 2 people it would be a bit too small to move around in. The bed was comfy, bathroom quite OK, blinds didn't block out much light, TV is small, no couch to sit on (no room!) but overall fine for sleeping in if you are out all day. The location is great - right next to the restarants, shops etc on Darling Harbour. There are so many choices to eat within a minutes walk - restuarants, food court, fast food etc pluls a Coles just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very small”
Reviews.Author: madsandra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in Febuary it was close to the lots of ammenities but the room was tiny. The view was appauling and the tiny tiny bathroom had no ventalation and rust around the shower . Staff was pleasant but we had no room service they ran out of soy milk at the bar and didnt even offer to go grab some for my coffee. Wont stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: 7dust
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel in fantastic location. It's very close to the Town Hall/City. It's built over the big shopping mall. Around there a couple of pubs and 24h stores. Also tram stop and Monorail is close. The service is very nice, but it's Australia, so that's normal :) The rooms are typical Ibis-like, but since this hotel is rather new, they are not worn out at all. If you can, pick a room on higher floor, overlooking the Darling Harbour. You have no idea how great the view of Sydney skyline is. There is a bus service to the airport which is faster and cheaper than going by public transport. Pricewise - more than OK. Overall - great pick.

Reviews.Title: “waste of money”
Reviews.Author: lauren j
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night in February 2012. The room was small, no ventilation as you cant open the windows. very small bathroom. we had to pay $35 to park there, and the spot we parked wasnt even a car spot. we drove around looking for a spot, they have a very small numbe rof car spots available, until we were eventually told "park against the wall" i went back to the front desk and disputed the fact that i paid $35 to park against a wall and was worried about my car as it was in a spot where other cars would need to drive past it. the girl at the counter rudely told us "well you didnt have to park in our car park". also, when we checked in they told us $50 would be frozen on our credit card, and released upon checkout. Half hour after check out it was still frozen, they advised it would happen later that day. the next day, still frozen, i rang them and was told it takes 5 days to unfreeze. that is pathetic if you ask me. I will never stay at this hotel again. the one pillow they provided was also like resting my head on a bag of rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing ,in need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: sunny562
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January for one night ..more than enough im sorry to say. The reception staff were polite and friendly. The corridor to the room gave a dreary 1st impression. The carpets by the lift were unhoovered and remained so for both days. The room itself was in desperate need of updating and decorating..There were black/scuff marks on the walls and door.Cracks and bodged looking plasterwork.New silicone needed on shower cubicle.Weirdest wardrobe arrangement but functional .Small tv. The room was booked for us via the internet by a relative, while we were staying in Brisbane and we had no opportunity at the time to read these reviews or realise we could book a harbour view room. We feel this was a very expensive room .We have stayed in many cities but were disappointed with the room standard from such a large hotel chain, Oh one plus point ...the breakfast was excellent. Just the view onto mossy unswept terrace area with missing grid showing bare wires wasnt the best! We left our email address as requested . to complete a survey but never received one from the hotel. We enjoyed Sydney and the location by Darling harbour is ideal.The ferry service is excellent for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISSAPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: mandy m
Reviews.Content: My husband and i dont get much time away together with us both working 38-50hrs a week and i even work in the industry and my pet hates is not a friendly welcome smile at checkin she just wanted to churn and burn us through quickly, (I then had my thoughts of OMG) got up to the room and no toweling provided room to small, walls dirty black marks, internet does not do the rooms justice, 1 pubic hair in shower AGHHHHHH. For 199 incl breakfast it was not acceptable, i wasnt in the room long enough to take picts, i just wanted to get out of there:( I value our money and we went to the novotel very friendly upgraded for a little extra but way better value bigger, clean room, mini bar, gym, jason on reception was fantastic understood our unhappiness, Novotel better value

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: WESTSIDESTORY2001
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful and there is free Internet (15 minutes) available to guests. This is very helpful for out-of-town (or country) travelers trying to make arrangements for trips to other cities. While the rooms are rather small, they are clean and relatively quiet. They have a nice little happy hour (5-6PM) in the small hotel bar. As an FYI, the rates are higher over the weekends. The location is about a 15 minute walk to the CBD, but it's a quick 10 minute walk to a good choice of restaurants, the aquarium, and other sites worth seeing. The Opera House is about a 25 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms getting old”
Reviews.Author: Mic_and_Boomy
Reviews.Content: Close to harbor, bars & resturant but could do with a good make over starting to look bot old.

Reviews.Title: “UNSATISFACTORY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was extremely disappointing to stay in a place where the rooms made you feel very chlostraphobic. The check in was excellent and very impressive staff member who never forgot my name rates a big thank you. No Wi Fi in the rooms, so to work you had to sit in a very uninviting area to work. I actually went to the Novotel to work in a more user friendly environment. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy first time guest”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed that your hotel decided to take an extra nights stay for the two rooms i booked plus bond on top of my bill without my knowledge or any indication for the duty manager who served us! Hence I'm sure you have already recieved me letter of complaint that I have faxe you yesterday!

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the lift”
Reviews.Author: lyniApolloBay
Reviews.Content: After picking up our keys proceeded to the lift to the 6th floor and the lift jammed. We were stuck in the lift for approximately 3/4 of an hour. When we finally got out we were dismayed to find that we had to request some water and were just sent on our way. No apologies as these things happen and. It is not the hotels fault they said. We have had no follow up from management. I am an accor card holder and would have expected some sort of follow up and compensation. Where are their procedures for this sort of thing occurring and where is the service. I will never stay in an ibis hotel again

Reviews.Title: “anniversay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, views and value. My wife and I wanted a getaway location where we could get to restaurants, bars, and entertainment within walking distance, yet when we wanted to escape back to our room only have a short distance to walk (ie 5mins). Rooms are small but this is to cater for the business market as well as leisure and in reality you only need the bathroom and bedroom to sleep and change. Harbor view room, which we paid a little extra for ( $30pn), was worth it for our stay as being Chinese New year the Dragon boat races took place right in front of us as well as the usual great harbor view. Breakfasts are great and well priced, as is happy hour 5-6pm at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: susieq2036
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Sydney you couldn't find a better location to stay. The Ibis at Darling Harbour is just a short walk from Sydney CBD as well as minutes from all that beautiful Darling Harbour has to offer such as the Aquarium, Imax theatre and Wildlife Park not to mention the shopping and restaurants at the door. Star City casino is about 10 minutes walk away and the monorail and light rail stops are about 200 metres away. The staff at the hotel seem to be friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but functional. It's a no frills hotel but it's clean and has everything you need. Do yourself a favour and pay that bit extra to get a harbour view room it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great price for good quality rooms. Very good location, close to lyric theatre and Darling Harbour. Restaurant choices are plentiful with a variety. Quick check-in. Good parking/ transport facilities close by, However parking not offered at a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my son in a twin room. Room was clean not a huge room but we were out all day so didnt bother us.In a great spot at darling harbour, close to restaurants, shops, Imax, aquarium etc, great service, breakfast okay, bacon horrid but that seems the norm at most hotel buffet breakfast these days. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “was good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The room was good but a bit small and it seemed that some of the things were a bit old or worn and didn't work as they should, like the blinds, especially the ones that moved horizontally, and the TV was small and not easy to look at unless you were directly in front of it. The location was great, within easy walking distance of darling harbour. The best part was the location and the people you have working there, they make you feel welcome. The worst bit was the not so easy way of getting to the hotel from the light rail, and the small TV.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel with a high room rate”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nt worth the money, paid aud 1078 for 5 nights, juz room, no bfast. room is small, shower room is tiny, doesnt allow much movement. no basic amenities such as dental kit or bedroom slippers. it was raining during my stay. tried to request for an umbrella but reception said they have none left. not the kind of service expected for an international hotel group. disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “ideal location to discover Sydney from”
Reviews.Author: Alistair B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Darling Harbour Ibis hotel in Sydney from November 8 to 10 2011 after the end of a two week ship cruise of New Zealand and Australia.I enjoyed my stay there my room was very clean with comfortable beds,big air conditioner and a great shower/bathroom plus an empty mini fridge and coffee maker.This was a great base which enabled me to see and take as many photos in my short three day stay as possible in many different areas of this fantastic looking city.This hotel is very reasonably priced compared to some of the other big worldwide chain hotels that are in that same area and is right next to everything transport wise ferries,mono rail e.t.c.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lady-Di-Sydney Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I celebrated our 35th Wedding Anniversary and stayed at the IBIS Darling Harbour mostly because of it's locality and affordability. We were received by friendly staff and after enquiring as to the reason for our stay, we were presented with a lovely bottle of wine. During our 4 day stay, we were able to trek around Darling Harbour, Sydney itself , Hyde Park, China Town, Paddys Market, Circular Quay, go to the Movies, ferry across to the Zoo, travel on the ferries, Monorail and Light Rail and go to see the new Phantom Musical. Everything is in easy reach. The choiice of cafes, restaurants and bars is fantastic. Will definitely be going back sooner rather than later. We have celebrated many special ocassions there and hopefully more to come.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend at right price.”
Reviews.Author: AndyRichmond
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate 50% off thru Accor and stayed one night Friday 27th January. The location is good being on doorstep of Darling Harbour and Casino for entertainment and dining. The rooms reflect the budget nature of Ibis but like anything you get what you pay for and all told the room and it's facilities were decent enough. Parking is not cheap at $35-00 but this is for 24 hours from time of check in so on the Saturday morning we did not have to rush and could have stayed in Sydney all day if we required before having to move car. Had breakfast on waterfront so can't comment of buffet. Would stay again on similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value from a TV deal”
Reviews.Author: Nthcoastjude
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Aussie day night. The rooms were booked by my sister after a deal she had seen on one of the Sydney morning shows ($165- for a family room including breakfast). She highly commended the staff for the way in which the bookings were handled. We had a family room (2 adults and 2 chn) and yes although they were small we only slept and showered in it - we were too busy otherwise. The beds were very comfortable and the room very dark in the morning (needed it after a late night out) Checkout was at 11am which was also an added bonus as most are 10am. The buffet breakfast was also good with a good selection to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the price”
Reviews.Author: annie4jewells
Reviews.Content: I only have one complaint.....parking is $35.00. Never have I paid to park a car in a hotel as a guest. It should have been mentioned on the web site for consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with red hot special price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very happy as we paid a greatly reduced rate using our ACCor card and a special deal. Excellent location and adequate accomodation, lovely staff but very squeezy room and an additional $35 for parking. Wouldn't feel it is worth the usual rate of around $150+.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable stay - close to darling harbor”
Reviews.Author: ImNomad
Reviews.Content: Ibis Sydney has professional staff and good service. I stayed there for 4 nights and I have no complaints. Location is good and close to CBD with easy access to public transport. So would recommend it for liesure or work.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service by Peter at front desk and all other staff members encountered during our stay. The rooms were spotless, modern and comfortable. Would recommend and will stay there again next time I visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so convenient to the Monorail and light rail making it very easy to get around Sydney. The staff were amazingly helpful and courteous at all times of the day. The buffet breakfast was extensive, and the restaurant staff were an impressive, efficient team

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms a little small, but clean! Able to walk to Darling Harbour shops, Cockle Bay and even Queen Victoria Building and Pitt Street Mall. Great for a short stay in Sydney. Great views of Centre Point and the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good position at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Joyce49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in December. Just like other Ibis hotels we have stayed, the room was small but clean. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpfull. Booked with lastminute.com for a good price. The full breakfast was $20 and was ok. We waited quite a while for the fried eggs we asked for but, once again brought to us by a very pleasant lady. The rest was bufett style which was fresh but, we find bufett's never quite hot enough. The hotel is right next the ferry (first stop) in Darling Harbour. Ate at a lovely chinese and it was the cheapest meal (and the largest) we had in Sydney. Only us in there though as it was between xmas and New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Room overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. Beds were not comfortable & there were marks on the spare blankets we went to put on the bed & they didn't appear to have been washed recently. We opted for turning aircon onto heat & upped the temp. Rooms were noisy we could hear the entire conversation clearly of the next room occupant using the phone. You would only use this hotel for an overnight stay. It is located in a great area is probably one of the most positive things I can say about it and the staff were helpful at checkin & checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect in Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: DemonTraveller Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Sydney for a Big Bash T20 game, which was at Olympic Park. Given the excellent train network in Sydney we decided to stay in Darling Harbour and train to the venue. We chose the Ibis because of the location and value for money and we were not disappointed! Very clean and neat rooms and we were stoked for the price we paid too. Hotel is just around the corner from Star City Casino and across an airbridge from a shopping centre which is situated right on the water and has a number of bars and the newest Hard Rock Cafe in the world! Could not fault the staff at all. Simone was lovely on check in and even had a bit of cricket banter with us. For value for money I highly recommend the Hotel Ibis Darling Harbour to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay in Sydney, be picky about which rooms though”
Reviews.Author: australiaman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ibis Darlling Harbour three or four times and have found it fine each time. Yes the rooms are smallish but are clean and the hotel is well located. There are worse places to stay in Sydney. I have reviewed this hotel before and am happy to update. I always ask for a harbour view room and you can book a harbour view room on the Internet site. A non Harour view room would be sad. It is well located at Darling Harbour, the Pyrmont Bridge Hotel two minutes walk from the Ibis is a great place for breakfast, coffee, dinner or a drink. You can walk to the city centre and Circular Quay if you don't mind walking. The local area is a great place to sit in the late afternoon for a drink or ie cream. The IMAX cinema is close by and a children's playground is close. The staff this time were more prepared to greet and smile than were previous staff. I rarely give businesses a second chance if I am unhappy with the service or product provided, so returning to the Ibis for me is a good sign. Do ask for a harbour view room though, the higher up the better.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms were quite noisy as you could hear guests in adjacent rooms, and cleaning staff talking in the corridor. Some of the guest towels were quite worn and need to be replaced. I accidentally left an item in the room , and the hotel was very prompt in returning it to me

Reviews.Title: “Very poor room over priced”
Reviews.Author: Nicole L
Reviews.Content: The room was really small and very very over priced they said it was a queen bed but it was a double. Bathroom really tiny and wardrobe if you could call it that. Do not waste your money staying here.

Reviews.Title: “In between Christmas and New Years”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff and the ground floor are the best thing regarding this hotel until you look out of the window ans catch a view of thr harbour, wow! The rooms are fully functional and although a little pokey they have everything you need and enough room to swing an almost full grown moggie. The bed was suprisingly comfortable and well supported a nights entertainment with an aquaintance as well a being a base for exploring for three days. The staff in the room areas are noticable by their absence (actually a complement as they are totally unobtrusive) and downstairs there is a cheery smile and generally a wave from all of the staff and a true feeling of hospitality. The breakfast bar is well worth the cost and is on par with overseas offerings in much more expensive hotels. One of the chef's popped out a couple of times and and checked which is always a good sign and the staff again were helpful and available. Great way to start the day especially after a another tremendous night on the turps that required some quiet reflection and some scrambelled eggs and bacon. I liked it and you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Side stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff and service were both exceptional. The noise levels were disconcertingly high with being able to hear other guests in the next room (conversation). Any arguments on the floor woke us up. I fully acknowledge the difficulty inconsiderate guests present and the Ibis can only manage that as best as possible. My only real disappointment was the that our budget was blow by, what I consider, 'advantage taking' car parking fees. Having to pay near full rate for car parking when we are paying customers at the hotel sours the stay. I have stayed at city hotels (CBD) and used the carpark next door and because we were guests we received a 'pass' which at least halved the normal charges.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent service and great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: OxfordSparky69 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If I ever visit Sydney again I would undoubtedly stop at this hotel. Very pleased with the room (had read in previous reviews that they were small, but we found they were adequate in size and comparable to a normal city hotel room) and the staff were always friendly and helpful. The location was excellent for exploring the city and everything is within a comfortable walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabs003
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very convenient. It is just a few minutes walk away from the Darling Harbour. That means it is close to good restaurants and entertainment. The hotel itself is average. Rooms are rather small and basic. We had breakfast included and the buffet bf was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but v small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ExpectTooMuch
Reviews.Content: Outstanding reception, great location, rubbish bar, but who needs one when you're in Darling Harbour! Free Harbour view upgrade at the mere mention of it being our honeymoon! Be careful of being near to the lift and hence the cleaner's store room, they rant and carry on in the morning as they prepare to start their day at work, but it's loud enough to wake you, and we had to remind them of the time and where they were in the end... Overall great location, but the Ibis on the other side of the harbour is cheaper and best placed for CBD and D Harbour walking. No view though...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, service fantastic, perfect position close to everything. The only disappointment is that the rooms are a bit small, need more storage cupboard/wardrobe or drawers and perhaps a TV upgrade! otherwise had a fantastic stay, staff very friendly and obliging. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Simple and neat hotel on a great location”
Reviews.Author: Vhchai
Reviews.Content: They have the fastest room check-in and check-out receiption I ever expereinced. If you are just looking for room and bed with Wifi, this is a good place to stay. The bed is very confortable, the room is equiped with iron and ironing board. The taxi ride from airport to there is about AUD48.00 The WiFi is chargable, they have 2 packages: about AUD12 for 2 and AUD24 for 24 hours. This hotel is for you if like the just-give-me-what-I-need and no-thanks-for-what-i-don't-use kind of place. For me, the winner is the iHome speaker device which I can plug in my iPod Touch for charging and listening to my favourite musics. The check-out time is 11am. You can ask for complimentary extension 'till 12pm. They have a self-service luggage storage area with lockers that can fit a 27" luggage, AUD7.00 per day. There is also a 24 hours convinience shop right opposite the hotel main door. The hotel is located just beside the beautiful Darling Harbour with lots of restaurant choices. Personally, I enjoyed the famous fish and chips (AUD19.00) from the Blue Fish restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, the room is small but is perfectly ok for a couple, service is good. But the only down side is the 2pm check in time. We arrived 9am in the morning so we have to hanging around city for 5 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory stay at Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very unhappy with the hotel and had a very restless sleep. There were noisy rooms on the same floor which kept us up all night. When we complained we were advised it was out of the hotels control to correct this situation. Minimal compensation was awarded via provision of free parking. We would have liked a guarantee of what management will do in future to correct this situation, there were no plans to prevent this occurring on future stays. We will no stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star location, two stars room (backpack standard), one star staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rolleu Jones C
Reviews.Content: 1. Do never take the top floors room at the corner. 50% of chances you will get a midnight orchestra of water pumps, draining sounds, shivering sounds, and numerous unknown noise. 2. Have been seeing five different rooms at different floors within few nights. Some bed sunk, and the worst part is their staff trying to convince you to accept the facts. My own unofficial statistic saying that, 60% of chances you will get a funny room. I hope they did some changes. Rooms at lower floor somehow with better conditions. 3. The hotel staff need to be re-training or resigned. I have no idea whether they were illy mistreated or salary weren't paid or group suffering from the monthly issue at the same time. when checking mails at the lobby, I have seen they showing different attitude towards different guest. Sometimes two faces at a same time handling two groups of guest. One classic line I experience during the stay while they trying to convince me the sinking bed is something normal in their hotel, "you know our price..." Yes I do know your price and Ibis is a three to four stars hotel, but it is very unreasonable to shift me to a room with sinking bed and pushing me to accept it. What more important is that, you are working in hospitality industry, you are representing your company. To clarify myself here, I am very polite and always communicate with soft voice. 4. Rooms at the upper floor are reserved for hobbits. It is not tiny, it is super tiny, I recalled prison-break and my experience in some hongkong hotel. Nice for one person. and if you have a half-person partner, he/she is in. 5. The only good services I had during my stay are from two Asian staff, either chinese or japanese. Conclusion: Goods : Location. Price. View. Bads : Everything other then that. Staff. Rooms. Bed. Facilities. Cleanliness. It almost like a two years old student hostel. Not suitable for honeymooners nor family. Suitable for sole traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but very low poor room and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a good and perfect location However, Room, Bed, and hotel facilities are so poor and really need to improve or change and do something badly about it as it's so waste about it as located in the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hokimai
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in a harbour view room, was pleasantly surprised with room. Very basic but we are not ones for staying in a room all day, we just need a place to sleep & shower, as we are always out & about. The location is great, with all forms of transport available. Great staff & you are able to use pool at next door Novotel. We obtained a 50% off rate, so this made it even more appealing, not sure I would want to pay full rate for the hotel though. Would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mark at reception is a total professional, he was most helpful in a difficult situation. Night staff were very helpful, polite and informative. Breakfast was amazing, the view wonderful. I'd love only one more towel in the bathroom or a towel rack to dry it off.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very stark and not welcoming. Breakfast was quoted at $15 pp, and then attempted to charge at $19.50. The $15 was only honoured after argument. I was also very disappointed with the fact that our luggage could not be left prior to check in and after checkout without hiring a locker at $7.00 each time, adding $28 ($14 each) to the cost of the stay. I have never had to pay in any hotel before to store luggage for a few hours when I have checked in early, or after checkout. I would not choose to stay in this hotel again. Although the location was excellent, overall I was disappointed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location and veiw”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and veiws, for travellers or business people.. also easy travel around the city and a taxi service out the door, for your requirments or short walk to the shops, restaurants, clubs, bars, aquarium, star city (the star)

Reviews.Title: “The most convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our time at Ibis, easy to get there from the airport and is convenient to Monorail and walk to city. It is well positioned and provides a neat, clean and friendly stay at a good price. Lots of fun things to do and see in walking distance. Check out the Wildlife Park and Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Very good typical Ibis hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jimcaleserty
Reviews.Content: Liked the closeness to Darling harbour all the shops and restaurants.Smallish rooms but clean and comfy and the price is good. All you need for a good night sleep and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS OVER NYT”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room served its purpose, nothing special. Not much room to do anything apart from sleep there. No room service available. Room clean and tidy just really small. Good view of the harbour. Close to other hotels and Darling Harbour. Took a long time to get a TAxi at 8.00am the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel accidentally issued keys to our room to another guest at 3am and so we had people barge into our room. The breakfast restaurant would not accept that we had pre-booked breakfast at a cheaper rate and were not interested in looking at the paperwork to confirm it. Due to the double up of allocating the room, they cancelled our keys but didn't tell us. The Manager and Staff were very apologetic and gave us a substantial discount but by then the experience had caused too much stress.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Went to a concert, found it hard to get a taxi, but concert over short walk to the Casino and back. Room was small but comfortable, and not overly expensive for the area. Would not spend weeks there, but good for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Due to a late decision to stat in Sydney to attend Richard III at Lyric Theatre at The STAR this proved to be a perfect location: close to venue, convenient for transport (especially as it was raining) by monorail, light rail etc.

Reviews.Title: “our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a great delight, the staff were very helpful, curious. I found the room smaller than I expected but we weren't planning to spend a lot of time in the room, had we been on a vacation in Sydney for a period of time it would have bothered me greatly. I thought the room was quite dated and was in need of refurbishing, but that was only a minor thing for us. Thank you and we look forward to staying again in the future. Regards Tony Browne Room 806

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located right on Darling harbour and only 30 mins by train from the Airport. Rooms are small (like most Ibis hotels) and a little tired but are comfortable and have all you need. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Firstly wrong room was given with 1 bed for 4 people we had to then move to a new room, then we were stuck in the car park as card did not work which made us late to the presentation, but other than these two mistakes everything else seemed OK. (Not Great but OK)

Reviews.Title: “Ibis - Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hallways leading to the rooms are outdated and feel dirty due to them being old. Our bathroom still had hair on the shower walls from previous guests. Reception was quite helpful. The location cannot be argued with. Had the bathroom been clean this hotel would be excellent value. However, the bathroom leaves a sour taste in your mouth as you question what else isn't clean that you can't tell when it is not.

Reviews.Title: “All Good”
Reviews.Author: SimonMacB
Reviews.Content: The main reason for choosing this hotel was it's great location. Only a few minutes walk from the Convention centre and Darling Harbour. For this reason the Ibis was very good. I found the hotel clean and tidy and the staff pleasant and friendly. The room was compact but not cramped, it was what I expected. Cleanliness standard was good and though facilities in the room were basic it had what I needed. I did not use the bistro or bar at the hotel so cannot comment on them, the nearby mall supplied dining out needs. Overall I would definitely consider staying there again if I needed a reasonably priced hotel in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Top View but over priced”
Reviews.Author: travellady007_11
Reviews.Content: as we had business to attend at short notice the Ibis was the only hotel that had accommodation available close to the convention center, the view was overlooking the Darling Harbour - very nice, great location only a 3 min walk, restaurants everywhere on the harbour. Room was small and very basic, close to the mono rail. But overall for the time we spent in the room was fine. The reception staff were very helpfull and friendly. If you want something fancy this is not for you but if you want something basic and close to restaurants and convention centre this is good. No restaurant for evening meals but there is a "basic" -very limited menu but as the harbour is only a 2 min walk you have so many choices it didn't worry us and same for breakfast we had breakfast one morning at a cafe in shopping centre then the next we got on the mono rail and went into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Mel P
Reviews.Content: Clean, easy to find. Right near the mono rail to get to everything. Needs a make over, very out dated. Needs more power points in rooms. Restaurant doesnt have any specials and limited menu. Found a spider in the salad - wasnt offered a "sorry" or a discount.

Reviews.Title: “stay again”
Reviews.Author: PDBPatel-NY
Reviews.Content: Great location and view form room. Rooms are clean and spacious for two.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney CBD accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Last minute accommodation option and able to use Accor Advantage Plus complementary accommodation voucher. Great location, very convenient, otherwise just a bed. Staff friendly and helpful, parking expensive but expected for inner city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing communications at Ibis , Darling harbour, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Javaid I
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to get an email of confirmation for our booking in October 2012. The reservation department cannot send an ATTACHMENT successfully. In spite of sending them 8 emails , and begging the to send me the Confirmation in an Email form , with all the details, WITHOUT any attachments , nothing has happens . It has left a bitter taste in the mouth, caused tremendous frustration and does not reflect well on ACCOR HOTELS , or IBIS HITELS of Sydney. Can no none investigate or oblige this hotel to comply to a simple request ? Not even an explanation is coming through !! Difficult to lodge a FORMAL COMPLAINT because the emails addressed to the General Manager are intercepted and do not seem to gt to him . Is there any one out there who can help us just o get a written confirmation , with the booking number and details of our booking ? in all my life I have never come across this kind of an appalling communication !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable except”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay was very enjoyable except the bed needs to have brake stoppers on the wheel as I sat in bed leaning against bed head to watch TV the base would roll away from the wall and as I sit on the bed it moves side ways.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We knew it was not 5 Star but we got very good value for what we paid for and expected. Location combined with cost were the winning factors. All staff we dealt with were great and represented Ibis and Accor very well - congratulations

Reviews.Title: “very convienient location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sydneyfarren
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Very soft beds. A 5 minute walk to the harbourside mall, with bowling, lazer tag, shops, and restaurants. 3 minute walk to the monorail station, and 10 minute walk to the ferry station.

Reviews.Title: “girlies weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has always been a great place to stay. It is central to everywhere you need to go to in central Sydney. I always stay here when away with girlfriends as we feel very safe here. The recent upgrade has made the hotel very inviting and the staff as always are very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Ibis - Where i chose to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always stay in Accor hotels, whether its the novotel or Ibis, they are the hotels we chose to stay in when we are in the city. Whether it's overnight or just staying the day and half the night, its where we stay. The staff are always friendly & polite, the rooms are always clean and its just enough to make our stay comfortable. I actually need to stay there again in December for 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Darling Harbour stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great being close to the wharf where i boarded the Pontoon for our Xmas function. What I did not like was the bedding as this was not adequate. The pillows were far too soft and did not sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great view of Darling Harbour! Good location to walk down to the water. Only a few minor problems - bad pillows and I could hear the person in the adjoining room (not too loud though). Otherwise all good.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice as a backup, but not even close to what you get for the same amount from M****T”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Compared to any Ibis in Europe, this was 1/2 of what I was expecting. Not bad, but you get more bang for the buck elsewhere. The only thing I can say is that the rooms are so tiny, and the beds are on the rollers, so they move. You cannot bring together 2 singles, so be prepared to feel like a kid once more. Nothing to complain in regards to being clean or service. Very pleased. I reate this as OK for business

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay: Friendly, respectful and helpful staff, especially house keeping and restaurant staff. Rooms were nice and clean. Had a great sleep and had no trouble with checkin and checkout. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but basic!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Sydney last week at short notice so checked out wotif.com.au to see what accommodation was available. It was obviously a busy week in Sydney because most places were fully booked and the hotels that had rooms were very expensive. My Thursday night at the Ibis Darling Harbour set me back $275, an amount that I would be happy to pay for a room on a holiday overseas but on a Thursday night in Sydney I have to admit feeling a little ripped off. The staff were friendly and the location was fab, I could walk out of the hotel and within minutes be at great restaurants but the price was steep. The rooms are very basic but equally very clean. The view was nice but it was the price that left a sour taste! Like any major city when a festive season approaches or there are lots of events on you can expect to pay a premium - I wouldn't choose to stay here again at this price but if you got it for $150 - $200 then it's worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Load and dull (good location)”
Reviews.Author: StevenBSydney
Reviews.Content: This is as bland a hotel as you could get. The rooms are noisy as hell. Given it's location on Darling harbour, expect it full of tourists and/or late night revellers (casino, bars etc very close) and you'll be woken all night by people coming home. The rooms are small, beds uncomfortable and the facilities are non-existant (no mini bar, tiny bathroom and iron/board are just crap!). No rooms service (they do advertise 24hr snacks...if you want microwaved stodge sent to your room...awesome for the late night drunks that fill this place). If you're staying for work/conference, there's nowhere to work in standard rooms. The ONLY redeeming feature is location; great bars, restaurants, casino (which is awful compared to it's Gold Coast or Melbourne cousins) and perfect if you want to be in Darling Harbour. Good access to CBD...but if you want to be IN Sydney; look for a CBD hotel...this is VERY ordinary and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Stay November”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exceptional as were the staff but had very disturbing and noisy neighbours both nights we stayed. We explained the situation to the staff when we checked out , the staff were very apologetic and explained that if that happens again to notify the reception and they will control the problem. Otherwise a very relaxing and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the Ibis. It was clean and the perfect size for 2 friends travelling together. The location was great, just steps away from the ferry stop in Darling Harbour. One of the finer touches was the iCharger alarm clock! It was nice to have a music player in the room, and also to charge my dying iPod! I think next time I would pay more and get a water view though.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: best location to visit Sydney just above darling harbour, walking distance to Sydney Opera house there is no better location to spend a few days in Sydney the Hotel has the best view on darling harbour and is just in the middle of it

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for our business trip. We had a cruiseon the Australia 2000 ship, so was able to just walk to the whalf and then a meeting within walking distance at Darling Harbour the following day. . The staff were very efficient but friendly and made us feel very welcome. We had a studio room which suited our short stay. We will definitely be back. K. & D. Parrott

Reviews.Title: “Hotel amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location as far as access to scenic Darling Harbour and Chinatown. Also reasonable access to City but required a more strenuous walk. Lack of conscierge and storage of bags ( without the additional cost) was a disappointment. Room facilities basic but reasonable for our overnite stay but would not have suited us if our stay was more prolonged. I refer to the the TV (small size), small size room and lack of bathroom space.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Generally the cleanliness and service are good and the location is excellent, The shower room looks very old and the water tape and water pressure is not relative high enough, it should be improved if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Weekender”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arigatou for the stay and the upgrade. My fiance Kayo is from Japan, and i enjoyed the visit and it was very kind to upgrade us to the Novatel. The room was clean and the view was nice. Next time i would like to try the resturant. Regards Adrian Mills

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to get a deal through my Accor Advantage Plus membership and stay at the Ibis Darling Harbour again and was quite pleased. Never disappointed when staying here and look forward to coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Spend $20 more and stay at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Parkinoz
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms. Shocking service. Rude staff. Charge $7 per suitcase for storage.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as feared”
Reviews.Author: jimmythebin
Reviews.Content: We were due to fly off on the holiday of a lifetime and I read the reviews on this hotel. I tried to change the booking as they were so bad but could not manage it. When we arrived after the most friendly greeting from Georgia -who also fixed my husbands phone-and we saw our room we were pleasantly surprised. No it is most certainly not the biggest room but it was not nearly so small as some people have implied. The bathroom is miniscule and tricky when drying yourself after a shower - double-jointedness would come in handy. The view from the window is phenomenal and its location is also very good. We made use of Sydney's excellent public transport with great ease as the station was just across the road. With all these pluses would I stay here again - I think I might try somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While the location of the Ibis Darling Harbour is excellent I thought the rooms were too small but other than that a thoroughly good 4 days in Sydney. The service was OK. The house bar closed too early for a number of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great bed/pillow”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was great value being right on Darling Harbor and right next to the Monorail and Harbor shopping centre. Its opposite the Aquarium which has the only Dungongs in Australia. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was modern. The lift was quick. The room was clean. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While the duty manager was great, ( could not do enough to assist). The hotel is central and close to the city. I thought the room was small with no storage space for luggage and clothing. So from that point of view very disappointed as we had to live out of the suit case for our stay and triping over the luggage in the room. And for the rating the hotel has I would of thought it would of been a little better in this area. I have been an Accor member for some time and asked about car parking and was told it is $35 per night. As we are thinking of another trip to Sydney in the near future and this time driving. But for a week the parking would be another $250 on top of meals and accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area to stay and visit.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Exellent location, very central and beautifull area. Found the room a little compact, and not soundproof enough as I got woken on several occasions when other guests came out of the elevator talking. Also very cold on the 4th floor. Thanking you

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Ibis Pyrmont”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The check in was the fastest I've had at any hotel. In less that 5 minutes my card was swiped the key handed over & I was on my way to my room. I had a view over Darling Harbour & saw the fireworks after the Rugby Cup. The blind & pullover shutters made sure that the room was dark for a restful sleep. It was no trouble to organise a late departure & then pay $20/hr after midday so we were able to use the room until our flight left .Being able to plug in for internet connection was very convenient too. I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Ibis hotel during Oct 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at Ibis hotel during the above date, everything is ok, the only sad thing is that i couldn't extend my stay at Ibis Darling Harbour due to the increase in price. Instead i got another hotel which is almost my first time price with Ibis Darling Harbour but with much bigger room, better service much more accessibility and with facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis”
Reviews.Author: KimB31 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms are small but have everything necessary, including irons and mini fridge. The noise between rooms is more noticable in this hotel, and unfortunately i was near the lift so the noise from that was heard all night. Also, the cleaners storeroom was next door and they were there early opening and shutting the door. Make sure you request not to be near the lift if you are there for more than one night. Recommended with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “daling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: OK stay. Good view. Close to darling harbour. Overall good. The services was good. THe thing i like was they had a locker service, so we didnt have to carry bags around all day. would recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found the Ibis to be of the usual high standard I have come to find each time I have stayed there.This trip had the breakfast and found it to be the usual quality that I expect from the Ibis. When I arrived found there was no drinks in the Mini-bar, no problem went downstairs to the Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would like to congratulate the Customer Service Staff at the Reception Counter, especially Peter, for the exceptional service offered to us and other customers when checking in and out of the Ibis Hotel, Darling Harbour. Peter went above and beyond our expectations in ensuring our needs were met, and resolving our Accor "Complimentary Night" problems. Thank you for making our weekend such an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Convenient location because of meeting in Darling Harbour Conference Centre. Comfortable bed and hot shower. Breakfast was OK but dissappointed as no other style of eggs except for powdered scrambled and boiled.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the poorest hotel we have ever been in terms of cleanliness and room size. We were very disappointed and my partner had vowed never to come back again. It is about time to renovate the whole building, rooms smelt as we entered, rooms very small, bed was not comfortable at all, parking was a problem, and a whole lot more. Sad to say, the location can never make it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pollymorphism
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on a business trip, and whilst the rooms are small, given the convenient location you wouldn't be spending much time in there anyway! Service was friendly and helpful, when I asked to move rooms due to noise from adjacent lifts, there was no problem at all. Rooms are clean and tidy, views on the harbor side are lovely! You can use the pool/gym facilities at the adjacent Novotel too. Good value for money, and given the high prices for Sydney hotels, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and locality. Room way too small for 2 people”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was very small. It was the smallest hotel room that I have ever been in. The view was the saviour which made us not feel like we were in a box. The room had no where for 2 people to sit, we had to get out of the room because of the size. Disappointed that the parking wasn't included in the price. The room was very clean and linen was spotless, other than cable ties found under one of the beds it was near perfect in cleanliness. Would recommend purely for the view and locality.

Reviews.Title: “Small room schmall room. Who stays in their room anyway?”
Reviews.Author: Waddrddtc
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the small room comments. The big windows fix that and you are in Sydney so get out and enjoy it! Staff were helpful. You get full use of novotel's pool so why pay $100 more? We dined at the Novotel restaurant as well and used Accor card so 50% off is amazing good value dining. Plus used my free night so recouped my membership fees almost in one night! Walking distance to monorail but just as easy to access light rail system too. Nip over to Harbourside shopping complex and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants overlooking the harbour for reasonable price. Catch the ferry at Pyrmont wharf to circular quay for cheap bay tour complete with opera house and bridge

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the bed and pillows were very comfortable and had a great nights sleep. I couldn't fault the hotel Except that there wasn't a shower cap and I had to ring reception to find out where they had hidden the room service menu. Overall well worth it. I have rebooked for next month when back in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “useless”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are too small, you couldn't even swing a cat. The reception staff weren't very helpful. The best thing was the location, but I wouldn't go back. We were supposed to have a superior room with a view, but you couldn't see for containers and a wall. If we weren't members of accor we definitely would not have stayed there. Unfortunately it was the only Hotel in the lacality that was available wnen we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I'm a member of the a-Club but this hotel, apart from the location, is not that attractive at all. The bar only opens early evening, expensive Internet. The reception staff are great and they will make sure you have everything but there's so much what they can do. Just stayed at this hotel because is just less than a hundred meters from my client. Will never stay again there.

Reviews.Title: “would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: glenda111
Reviews.Content: we where warned that the rooms were tiny....and they were.....we were warned there was no storage for clothes...and there wasn't...but what we did get was a smile to greet us,a clean room,fluffy white towels and a comfy bed.If you are like us and are out all day enjoying all sydney has to offer this will suit you as the location is fantastic.we also enjoyed the Breakfast (only $15) if you book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms mixed up and charged twice.”
Reviews.Author: Bik3i
Reviews.Content: Booked an overnight stay at the Ibis to go to a trade show for the weekend. Upon arrival the receptionist asked for my debit card so they could take the details as payment insurance. Went upstairs to find that instead of the twin room we had asked for they had given us a double bed. Upon informing the receptionist of this, she informed us that there was an electrical fault in the room we had booked and so they had moved us to the room next door, and that we would be moved the following day. She did not ask if my collegue and I minded sharing a bed, which I found highly inapproriate. As compensation she told us we would not be charged for the first mornings breakfast, and that we would be moved to a twin room the next morning. So they gave us $30 of scrambled eggs in place of a nights stay in a twin room that cost over $200. The next day we spent out of the hotel, and upon returning in the afternoon we found our room had not been changed. We went downsatirs and asked to be moved to the room we had booked. It appeared the woman who we had spoken to the previous night had made absolutely no note that we had requested a room change. The gentleman at the desk who served us and gave us new key cards actually rolled his eyes at my collegue when she asked when we should return the old room key cards before answering. On the morning we checked out, I went to check my bank balance and found that the money for the hotel was not visible in my account, so I presumed they had already charged me. Upon checking out however, I was informed that my money was simply frozed to insure that I was able to pay for the hotel but had not been withdrawn. I was then told that the money could not be unfrozen for three business days and that I had to find another way to pay. At no point during the booking of the hotel or upon checking in was I informed that they would freeze my money and require another payment, and when my card was taken upon check in I was told they were just taking the details of my card, not actually accessing any money. I paid using a family members credit card and was told that the hotel would contact their bank and my funds would be unfrozed by the following day. The following day the frozen money was not released to me. Instead they were taken from my account by Ibis, meaning they have now taken two payments for the one booking, leaving us over $500 short. It has been four business days since check out and I am still waiting for my funds to be returned. The few good points of my stay at Ibis would be that it is conveniently placed in Darling Harbour with nice views. However there are also countless other conveniently placed hotels in Darling Harbour with even better views that will not stuff up your booking and charge you twice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis at Darling Harbour provides clean & quiet rooms at an affordable price, particularly given it's close proximity to the City of Sydney & the restaurants of Darling Harbour & Cockle Bay. Parking is restricted to 2 metres & is a little pricey, but overall very happy with my stay

Reviews.Title: “Sydney trip”
Reviews.Author: JSVx
Reviews.Content: The room we had for AUD$190 was so small one of us had to stay in bed so the other can get dressed. The shower cubicle was so small you'd struggle to pick up the soap if dropped. The soap holder was lose on the wall, didn't take used towels but did give us clean ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: goingsomewheresoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights for a conference in September 2011. Seems like the hotel guests were mainly staying there for conferences in Darling Harbour - didn't really see any tourists or families amongst the guests. Got lucky with my room - it had a double bed and a single, so I had quite a bit of space and somewhere to put my suitcase. Another colleague only had a double bed, and said that it was only 6 steps from the entrance to the window. Staff were fine - a couple of times, I had to get my room cards re-scanned - bit of a pain having to go back to reception, queue up, then go back upstairs. Had the buffet breakfast for 2 mornings - all the standard items, nothing special. Went to cafes in Darling Harbour for the other 2 mornings - plenty of options. Room was clean, bathroom was probably the smallest i have seen and the shower door leaked. Overall, a great spot to stay if you're not planning on spending much time in your room and if you want to be central to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Weekdays a great palce to stay”
Reviews.Author: jenTamworth Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thursday night stay was quite, Friday night exceptionally noisy with multiple noisy people arriving and leaving room next door throught the night until early morning. Would not stay again on a weekend night as this is the 2nd time it has happended.

Reviews.Title: “We meet again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was the best, straight out to darling harbour and all the bars and restaurants and a short stroll to the star. We loved the fact it was all at the doorstep and thus getting back to hotel was easy and not a huge hike. Bed was very comfortable. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: happydaysCanberra Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in was prompt and professional. All staff were friendly. Dining room service was good and food was excellent. Prymont Room is very small but functional. Bathroom also small but functional. If you're only looking for a place to sleep while enjoying Sydney this is a good choice. Parking is expensive but plenty of room and very handy. Location right on Darling Harbour is great as it is next to the monorail and a station is virtually a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: philbye
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a conference. Room was small but neat and clean. Staff were friendly and food was OK. Best thing was location to Darling Harbor and city centre. Easy walk to a range of attractions plus public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Floor The Place Stunk and attracted Smokers & Drinkers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Smokers Floor The Place Stunk and attracted Smokers & Drinkers, It obviously attracted the lower class of people. People were coming back pretty noisy after drinking and lots of smoking. I regret not asking about smoking in the hotel when I booked

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: you can't bet the location if you like walking around the habour and restaurants. buffet breakfast was excellent value and quality - we had walked around to compared with restaurant prices in the area, and returned to the hotel to enjoy the ful buffet. Our only disapointment with our stay was that the rooms were smaller than we expected and no units contained a bath or spa.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: ScubaZorro
Reviews.Content: Let's face it... Sydney hotel rooms are expensive. I've stayed at this hotel before and will stay here again as its rates are reasonable and it is excellently located in a happening area for tourism and night life. As per standard Ibis Hotels are do not have spacious rooms and are sparsely furnished. You'll have everything you need, but not much luxury. Service is good (3* hotel in mind).

Reviews.Title: “WORST EVER, Left after viewing the room.”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever seen. Upon entry to the lifeless, dull & seriously stale atmosphere of reception you are greeted with uncharismatic service straight away. Post check in my partner and I were excited as this was the first night of our holiday. That is, until we got to the room. Our hearts sank when we opened the door to see a shoe box sized poorly furnished decrepit room. After two minutes of trying to find a positive there were none apart from the view through the dirty window. The bed was poorly made and on roller wheels that made it slide and move. Evidence the room had been poorly cleaned included a splinter of glass on the bed and hairs everywhere. Other uncomplimentary features included chipped and worn away edges, holes in the wall from a previous fitting, a TV that was about the size of a small laptop screen and did not receive digital channels and a terrible bathroom.
