It was on par with a good hostel room (except most hostels I have stayed in were cleaner) with a $279 a night price tag. TERRIBLE. I went to reception to sort it out and was told they could not help me. We rang and booked straight away at the Sebel Surry Hills and then left. The Ibis manager then rang (as we were booking in at the Sebel) to tell us we would have to still pay. Ha! After my partner explained the situation we have not been charged yet bit we will wait and see. The Sebel was FANTASTIC from the second we arrived. FAR better atmosphere, high standards, professional staff and brilliant rooms. My partner and I will NEVER set foot in an Ibis again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location is that is here”
Reviews.Author: ImpulseIX
Reviews.Content: The location is great for Sydney as you are within walking distance of most attractions and the convention center. The hotel itself needs a freshen up as it is showing its age. The rooms are clean, but the rooms need some service. Make sure you get a harbor view room as the looking into apartment blocks is not that great when you are in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: kreinikkala Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for location and price. Some problems with floor water drain in bathroom. As water doesn't flow through floor drain it gets dusty, moist and starts to smell musty. This is breeding ground for Legioners bugs and few others. Please start a cleaning program for these drains (monthly ?) to ensure safety of your customers. Bed could do with some stops (vedges etc) to restrict movement forward as someone is leaning against the wall wathing TV etc.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is very small. Toilet is bigger than it should be (Bedroom is supposed to be bigger). Full buffet breakfast is cheap but it's very simple and crowded. The location is near Pyrmont Bay Tram Station (5 mins walk). This hotel is average.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Darling Harbor Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis Darling Harbor on 24/8/11 while attending a professional association event at the Convention centre. While the room was smaller than i had expected that was not an issue as i was literally only spending a few hours in the room to sleep anyway. I got a Darling Harbor view room which was fantastic.The room was very clean and the hotel was very quiet. Proximitry to the Convention centre is excellent, being only a few minutes walk. I thought the room cost prepresented excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay as so handy to town & the harbour. No facecloths or bath mat the first day but they were there the next day. Great friendly staff. Very good meals & not rushed between courses.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, functional and great location”
Reviews.Author: woodie12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in June whilst attending a conference. Location cannot be faulted - easy access by train from the airport, easy walk to the conference centre and Darling Harbour for food, drinks and shopping. Sensational views over the city and Darling Harbour - there were fireworks one of the evenings - great uninterrupted view. Staff were friendly, checkin and out were efficient and friendly. One plus was that I arrived at 9am to drop off my bag and was given immediate access to my room. Now that was a first! Thanks! Breakfast buffet was excellent - no complaints. Rooms are small - well actually the smallest I've seen - but functional and fine for my purposes. Sitting at the desk looking over the harbour and the bridge was fantastic. Great for a more reasonable price than the rest of Darling Harbour hotels. Also a good alternative if you just need a place to sleep and have some meals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Danielle H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis Darling Harbour to attend an Exhibition. Though the location and views were fantastic, could not help but notice the rooms were very small, the television no larger than my laptop monitor, and that , (although clean), was very pokey and depressing. The only thing that saved it was the view of the Harbour. Ordered nachos from the restaurant for $18, the result was a rather ungenerous and grossly overvalued "meal", which took 20 minutes to be produced with only 5 other visible patrons, 2 of whom were at the bar..Overall, will choose to stay eleswhere next time as the public transport in Sydney is outstanding and certainly workable in future.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation Hotel Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again but next time pick the room with the balcony! Not disappointed with the room and the view was spectacular, treated to a fireworks display on our first night.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis on the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here before over the years I expect at least the same standard, however at each visit there is often something which has changed for the better. The staff are always helpful with requests, questions and suggestions. I have found each member with whom I have had contact, to be most courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Property”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I could not find fault until I travelled home and found I had left my suit trousers in the room and the staff could not locate them. It woud seem that they have now been removed or not in the lost property where i would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second stay at Ibis in two years - the proximity to the Darling Harbour Conference centre means it is an ideal location to bed down - speaking of which it would be handy that the beds have wheel stops on them to keep them in place. The suites with the harbour view are fantastic with the MONO rail passing through

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: DaniRMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Location Is the old satisfactory part of this hotel. It's run down, old and not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: snake17 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I feel quit confident staying in an Ibis. I know what to expect. Rooms are a bit small but well set out. Beds comfortable. This Ibis is an ideal location in Sydney. Right at Darling Harbour and the Monorail. Get a water view if you can - spectacular at night.Staff are friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very convinient. It is very close to Darling Harbour and city centre where you can go for shopping and play around. Very nice front water view during the day and even beautiful with the lights at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelObession
Reviews.Content: Great Location is what gets this hotel its mark. Monorail right out the front. Harbour Side Mall right in front of us, plus so much more! Our room was tidy & clean. We had been warned that rooms are small & that bathroom has step up into it, so we where not shocked to discover this. We where located on the top floor, back corner, so our view was out the back - but we where not there for the view, otherwise would of booked for a darling harbour view. Due to being small, there was limited places to put bags, but we where there for one night. Think if it was longer we would of felt a little crapped after awhile. Stayed in other IBIS before & they are the same decor & features. It was quiet & we both slept well. Normally we are the type that it takes us a few nights when out of our own beds, so where thrilled that we both had a great sleep. We where thrilled at the location, as we used the Mono rail a few times, along with the walk way to Harbour Side. Didn't eat there, so no comment. Where happy with the service & was very happy that they gave us a late check out, as we where sailing the next day and didn't need to go until 1pm, so this was a nice surprise. Woudl stay for short stays in the future & would recommened

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ibis, Darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and price. The service was efficient and the staff knowledgeable and professional. All areas were clean. The breakfast was tasty and had an excellent variety of food choices. I did not much enjoy the dinner I ordered as the food was cold and I think it had been prepared earlier and reheated, but I enjoyed every other aspect of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Ccrandsun
Reviews.Content: Good location - right on darling harbour adjacent to convention centre. Rooms clean but small. Free wifi only in lobby and only for 10 minutes a day.

Reviews.Title: “Never staying again”
Reviews.Author: SmittyMelb
Reviews.Content: For a business expo at the convention center, the location of this hotel was great. That is the only thing going for it. The staff at the front desk were rude and unhelpful. The rooms were small with no power points near the beds at all. We had to park a tall van and were given the wrong information regarding the height of the car park. $35 dollars a night to park a vehicle on top of the room rate, didn't include breakfast, which at $20 is a joke. We walked to the harbour and had a great breakfast for $8.50. Got charged for a movie we didn't watch and they couldn't tell us what movie it was or what time it played. This hotel also charges 1.5 % on all credit cards! What a way to make some extra money hey. Lifts are very slow and the cleaners are noisy and didn't do a great job of making up our rooms. Tiny TV's in our room with no wifi until the 8th floor. The list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thanks goodness all we used our hotel room was for sleep!!! When we got to the hotel the first thing I said when we walked into the room was 'you got to be kidding me...', I paid $370 for 2 nights in a queen suite... this thing was a shoe box with a double... the decor was old and the architraves were falling off the walls... Definitely didn't feel that I got my money's worth... But it was clean... and a relativley cheap taxi ride for where I needed to go...

Reviews.Title: “convention in sydney”
Reviews.Author: EdS16
Reviews.Content: location was very ideal. neat convention area and shopping provide a beautiful view of darling harbor

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: luckylane1
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the heart of Darling Harbour, monorail is right outside, beautiful view of the city (especially at night) and shops right at your doorstep. Unfortunately though the room we stayed in was very small. There were 3 of us and there was only room for our beds, a study desk and not much else. Also there were no bedside lamps so when my 3 year old needed her afternoon sleep it was difficult. We were put on the Family floor which was just above the lobby which was handy as we didn't have to go far in the lift.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better than this.”
Reviews.Author: Barbra_M
Reviews.Content: Why bother? You can stay at any number of other hotels and get rooms 3 times the size. And no charge for the skinny milk for the late night coffee. Pathetic really. My Hong Kong hotel was bigger and service better. Oh and haven't even mentioned the grout missing from the tiles in the bathroom. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, position & service”
Reviews.Author: Greengal1
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights in a Pyrmont room, & were delighted to receive a upgrade to a Harbour View room on arrival due to overbooking. Mark at the desk was delightful, so helpful & courteous. The room was basic but the view was awesome. One downside is the rooms aren't soundproof & you can hear other guests coming & going at night. The buffet breakfast was great value with a large selection of hot & cold food. The hotel position is great, & so close to the monorail station for easy access to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the stay very enjoyable and good value for money. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very good, looked in vain for cheese, though. The rooms were small, but we realise that the bathroom was added later and took the space. Rather have a bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible bed!”
Reviews.Author: Kes08 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all that you need, in a great location, close to Star City and the Lyric Theatre. The rooms are small but were all that you need when staying in the city. The staff were helpful, service was great and breakfast was excellent. The only disappointment was that the bed had a ridge on either side in which each person was forced to lie. If you stayed dead still it was comfortable but if you tried to move out of the dip, you couldn't do it and remain comfortable. As a result my sleep was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location for the price was excellent.. Staff were pleasant and professional, room impressive for the money having an ipod dock and flat screen. An all round great stay Adam Pike I dont have 200 characters, and i find it stupid you have to provide that many when it is a two minute feed back..

Reviews.Title: “Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the rate is rather high, but I guess that's what you pay for being at Darling Harbour. Room is the usual Ibis format, but it was adequate for single traveler. Menu at the bistro can be improved, not much of a choice for those who choose to eat at the hotel. Saw many guests walking away after studying the menu.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible hotel at a great location....”
Reviews.Author: Striderrftn
Reviews.Content: Located at the Darling Harbour, Ibis a just a short walk away from the city centre and is very close many fantastic attractions including the IMAX cinema, HarbourSide Shopping Centre, Wildlife World, Sydney Aquarium, and Maritime Museum. However the hotel itself is TERRIBLE! I checked in on the 30 June, and was given a Pyrmont view room with a leaking sink, a sliding bed, and a craping ironing board. After talking with the on duty manager, I got a free upgrade to a Harbour view room. On day 1, the central heating system went off in my room while I was adjusting the temperature. Then they gave me a portable heater to cope the situation. Today I came back to the room after visiting Blue Mountains and found my sleeping shirt missing! The reception told me that it must had been taken by the innkeeper because it looked like the bed sheet... Sydney is absolutely a great place to visit but now I can't wait to go back to Melbourne because of the horrible experience in Ibis Darling Harbour!!!I'd rather spend a couple hundred dollars more to get some decent service...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Nights Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Taking into consideration the quality standard of this Hotel i can honestly say that we enjoyed our stay very much. Check -in was easy and quick, rooms were clean , staff were friendly including those in the Bistro/Bar area and we would have no hesitation in staying again in the future..

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: rileyinc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for 2 nights, managed to get one night on a package deal that included breakfast - breakfast was very nice - would have to say it is the only buffet breakfast that we have ever had that the food was kept hot!! The rooms are basic but adequate. We were told there were no queen rooms left (pyrmont view) and the room would have 2 single beds. But it actually had a queen and a single and was a bigger room than our friends had on the harbour side with 2 single beds. The beds were comfy. As for the hotel managers comments in a post below, we could only find 4 tv channels - don't know where the other 12 were! Bit disappointing but we weren't in our room much. The only thing we didn't like was the paper thin walls and the constant banging of room doors as people returned from their evening festivities. It just echoed through the whole place. And we could hear every noise from the guys next door, wouldn't want a crying baby in there! The parking is a pain, but hey that is the city. We just parked in the carpark ourselves and if you are not taking the car out from the time you check in to check out, it is cheaper to do it that way. Was only $28 a day instead of $35. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Would stay there again. This is not a luxury hotel, so if you don't expect that , you will be happy. Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “get away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The 1st room i was given was not good. bed crap. Tv remote didnt work, fridge noisy. But Simone the lady on the desk was lovelly and changed me no worries 2nd romm great. Trying to get out of the car park is an other story. I dont know the dudes name but by the 2nd time i had to walk all the way up to the hotel cause the lifts where not working, and the 2nd time i had to reverse my car from the boom gates, I was very upset being very late by now. He tells me it nobodies fault and tells me twice he's trying to help me, When i just wanted to get the hell out!!!! The parking dude said i was the 2nd person that dad with this problem.

Reviews.Title: “bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Tiny little box of a room, did not expect the world in size but very small. We had the 'pyrmont' view which was a bit ordinary. The most annoying thins was we checked in and told we could not park in their car park, had to go to the next one down and walk up. On top of that annoyance we had to pay $35 to hotel when we realised the next day we could of just paid $28 direct to car park. Out of courtesy, especially for our inconvience, they could of advised us, that rather than taking another $7 from us for our trouble. Nice little extra earner for the hotel. Not good enough!! Not staying there ever again, not recommending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Most of the stay was a pleasure. there was a little hallway noise which cant be controlled by the hotel. The only complaint I have is that the food was not good at all ( for breakfast that is ) and the coffee at breakfast was un drinkable. Apart from the food the stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here please be advised that you take life in your own hands.”
Reviews.Author: NicolasBIshop2010
Reviews.Content: Nicolas Bishop Never stay at the IBIS DARLING HARBOUR. The guests on the second floor were left to defend themselves while drunken idiots tried to break down doors to rooms. The security st the hotel just gave them a warning. If this was my home the police would regard this as attempted break and entering. What made matters worse the phone for reception was not even plugged in. After extensive travel world wide I have never felt as unsafe as I have at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Location with everything you need to be entertained. Nice clean rooms with picture perfect views only minutes to shops and city shopping.Easy access to transport. Friendly staff and affordab;e rates

Reviews.Title: “Poor Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was the smallest most pockiest accomodation in the hotel. The shower did not work properly. There was continual noise from surrounding rooms. At 0500Hrs every morning you were wocken by extreme noise. The television did not function properly as it was not tuned properly to a station. The digital radio had no instructions and was set to 0430Hrs. The breakfast although hot was not cooked to order like other hotels. The bread and crousants appeared stale.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: kazahAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night after holidaying with family. Was a fantastic end to our week in Sydney. The hotel is perfectly positioned and the view over the harbor amazing. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was plentiful with a good selection. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was good experience, good ambiance, excellent location,good food,near walking distance of POI - like star city, Sydney tower, shopping center. its worth staying and at a very reasonable price.i will surely recommend to my family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Sydney DOUBLE BILLING HORROR”
Reviews.Author: kamusta
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney for an exhibition and stayed at Ibis for 4 days. We booked our 3 rooms through their online reservation at their website. When we first made the reservation, we were notified that there was an error in their system and our booking was not finalized. We tried again using a different card and the booking was finalized and confirmed. Upon receipt of the credit card billing, we were shocked to discover that we were charged TWICE even though we only received 1 confirmation. We contacted the hotel but was told that the package we took was non-refundable. Therefore, even if we did not receive any confirmation for the other booking due to the hotel's system error, we will not be refunded for the booking. In short, we are being forced to pay AUD$1,836 for a booking that was NOT confirmed. They offered to extend the credit until June 2011 but we only go to Sydney once a year for the exhibition so we tried if they can extend it until June 2012. Again, our request was denied. All these happened BEFORE we even left for Australia. During the trip, the reservations manager offered to look into the matter but after explaining the whole thing again, we were only told that it is non-refundable and cannot be extended until 2012. Makes you wonder why they even bother asking you if they will not do anything about it. We also tried to talk with the hotel management but we were being passed from the front desk to the reservations department with no one offering to address our situation. Even if the location of the hotel is good because it is close to the exhibition center, it is not worth paying AUD$3,672 for three rooms where there is no disposable slipper and 2 TV remote controls were not working. If we do not get any consideration for refund or extension of credit until June 2012, we will be filing a formal complaint to the Manila office of the Australian Trade Commission at the Australian Embassy and sending a complaint letter to the Australian Tourism Board.

Reviews.Title: “Pyrmony Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Very close to monorail and lightrail stops. Television reception not always good. Mattress slightly sunken in the middle already. Very basic services. If you intend to leave your luggage with the hotel should you arrive earlier than the check-in time or leaving later than the check-out time, paying-lockers are available to fit carry-on luggage. Check-in suitcases are left in the office's baggage holding area and cannot be secured.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Hotel Pyrmont”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location - excellent staff, rooms a little on the small side but still comfortable. breakfast was good quality and reasonably priced for location. Enjoyed our time and appreciated the professional and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: IBIS at Darling Harbour is a very convenient location especially with the close proximity of the Monorail with access to the CDB. Check-in was convenient and prompt. The room was comfortable and clean. My wife and both slept well. Parking was very accessable. We enjoyed an excellent buffet breakfast which set us up for the day. All the staff we came into contact with were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Went there as an anniversary present”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not Happy.... Used one of my free nights and they put me on the first floor right next to the stairwell where during the night someone had a party breaking all records on the decibel scale. First floor, no views of the harbour , the room was TINY and no sleep .... not a really good stay for what was suppose to be a special occasion. VERY disappointed

Reviews.Title: “In 3rd May out 9th May 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is small for man and wife, otherwise everything is perfect. One of the best run hotels i have stayed in (after 20 years as a travelling salesman) Perfect location, excellent value, happy and helpful staff. A good breakfast to start the day and a nice terrace (public terrace) to finish the day. There is no porter but a baggage trolley is available and I am sure that anyone who needed help would get it. I repeat, one of the best run hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet staff Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked in, room fine, had a lovely meal at darling harbour then went to our room for the night. In the deal, if you pay a $1 you can get either parking, wi fi or a buffet breakfast for two. We opted for the breakfast deal. We arrived at the bufffet at 10.27am with patrons eating their morning meal and a vast amount of food in the servery areas. The attendant on the cash register was finishing his float and he rudely told us the buffet had closed. We questioned him regarding the 10.30am cut off time and he was blunt and to the point that they had to get the area ready for mid morning. We went to the checkout area and explained the situation and asked for parking to be included in the deal instead of breakfast. We were told we cannot swap parking for breakfast and they accepted we were on time for breakfast and they refunded the extra dollar we paid for the deal. Parking was the same value as breakfast. We paid the $40.00 for parking and left. The main reason for staying at the Ibis was the package deal, would we stay again NO. Poor Poor Poor Service.

Reviews.Title: “Great View & Location_Small/Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: JohnNich
Reviews.Content: The Ibis reception staff were polite and helpfull. We stayed in a "Superior Queen" room, and wondered what the standard would have been like. The room was tiny with hardly any room to hang clothing, no drawers or space to unpack bags. We were in Sydney for a wedding and had brought suits and dresses for the occassion but the limited space made everything from storage without crumpling to actually getting ready difficult. The bathroom would only fit one person at a time with showers which were more adapt to a caravan, making it nearly impossible to bend down to wash your feet. On the Monday we had requested a late checkout so we could have a long lie in to recover, however, we changed our minds when service staff started cleaning at 6am greeting each other down the corridor and talking outside our room. Vacuuming of rooms started at 8am, it was then we decided to rise and go for breakfast to get away from the noise. The location is faultless being minutes from shopping and dining at Darling Harbour, and several more to the centre of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Our brief stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location and represents good value for money. The staff were all helpful and the room was small, but very clean. The bed was also very comfortable. I would have preferred a larger room but we got value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and staff were very friendly. Rooms clean Food however? I would eat out next time. I actually went to the Novotel Restaurant and it was disappointing. When staying at an IBIS, it is what you pay for. I would be happy to stay at this hotel again, espicially as it now offers free WIFI and papers when travelling on business which is very convient

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location Excellent, cleanliness good, Bed Average, (SPRINGY) Got a special deal that Included B/fast that was pretty average . Toaster had a malfunction, as did the pancake machine, the main coffee machine wasn't working, we had to clean our own table to sit down, There wasn't extra cutlery out for people to access, The toaster is in an awkward position, The list goes on! Would of been very annoyed if we had paid full price as it definately wasn't worth the normal rate!! Its obvious its all about Location location! It was ok for the price we paid !

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We travel all the time and spend a lot of time in Sydney and other major cities. We found the room claustrophobic. There was not even a water jug in the fridge. Only 1 pillow each, the bed was hard, there was a white sheet as a bedspread!! and the breakfast although nice was not as good as any others we have stayed at. Overall I feel the price was over the top compared to the rooms we have stayed in previously and we were both very very dissapointed as it is a great location. Incidentally, we are not fussy and I have never ever wrote negative reviews before as we take things as they are ........but not impressed!! Are all the rooms as bad as this or were we stuck in one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - One Negative”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was fantastic, with the hotel and its staff behind the desk. The location was fantastic and the rooms were quite comfortable. The only complaint I have would be against the Maitre'd in your restaurant. We stood at the counter for 5 mins before he acknowledged we were there, he was not friendly and shoved the menu in our face.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: K1rst89
Reviews.Content: Great location in Darling Harbour only a few mins walk to shops, resturants and the ferry. The rooms are a reasonable size for 2 people but next time I would request a view facing Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney on a budget”
Reviews.Author: IanPEngland
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the rooms are small and utilitarian. It's a modern Ibis. We chose it for the price and location, knowing that Accor do budget hotels well and we were only staying 3 nights. Everything was as expected. The friendly welcome, cleanliness of the room, value of the good hot and cold breakfast buffet. Shame that the food service was breakfast only. It was a bit strange having a beer at the small bar in the reception area, but it gave us a chance to chat to the manager and staff. The proximity of the elevated motorway behind the hotel was worrying, but we didn't hear any traffic noise inside, even with a room at the back. The location is great for Darling Harbour and a vast choice of eating places, but a 20 minute walk from Circular Quay. However, with a taxi rank right outside, we had no problem getting to our cruise ship. The rating reflects the value, not the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived I had a room at the back of the hotel (no view) and the springs in the mattress were broken... When I spoke to the front desk, they promptly sent someone to check it out & within 15 minutes I was in a new room witha more comfortable mattress & upgraded to the front of the hotel with an awesome view over Darling Harbour. I was very impressed with their speedy action's to resolve some initial issues & the rest of my stay was comfortable & relaxing....

Reviews.Title: “The Bliss At Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best location,great service,We will be back for a longer stay in the future.We had a room on the first floor that was a little bit cramped for three people,but we were only in the room to sleep ,so that was fine.Next time we will get a bigger room on a higher floor

Reviews.Title: “It only takes one bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would say the only downside to another stay at this hotel was the service in the resturant was appauling, otherwise I enjoy staying in this hotel, the front desk staff were great, the late checkout was appreciated and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by its location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This place had so many things bad about it i don't know where to begin! Very small rooms/aircon didnt work/loud water sound in the wall/double bed was up against walland hard to get out of and also had a big dip in the middle. I'm normally a very positive person but struggled to find much good about our stay. It's close to the convention centre where we were going to everyday but was not worth it for that.

Reviews.Title: “Much better stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay with the hotel very much, we stay late last year and there was a much nicer vibe because the front desk and restaurant staff were different to our previous visit and a great improvement. The location is fantastic, breakfast good value and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “noisey and tiny”
Reviews.Author: MDKbrisbane
Reviews.Content: my hsuband and i stayed at this hotel with friends for two nights thinking it would be a great location for what we were doing in sydney. true, it has a great location and nice views but that is it. i would of been ok with the tiny rooms or the staff who didnt know much if i could of sleptt even for one night. the constant banging of the doors all night and the 2nd night was even worse. i spoke do a duty manager and he assured me it would stop but no more 5mins later it still went on. where was security? i could even hear the toilet flushing in the next room. all night. the manager contacted me the next day and was very nice and refunded our money. he handled the situation very well and was concerned over my complaints. i do hope they get the locks on the doors changed and get more training for the staff ,and up dating and soundproofing the rooms it could and should be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and the location is excellent. I found the rooms a little small for the price you pay but it was only to sleep so it wasn't too bad."There was plenty to choose from at breakfast but the food wasn't kept in warmers so some things were cold on mornings when it wasn't busy and the food wasn't being replenished quickly. The location of the hotel is fantastic with terrific views of the city from the terrace and Harbourside shopping centre right on the doorstep. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LindaHScotland
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the redeye from Hong Kong and so were really relieved when we could check in even though it was 8 in the morning. The rooms, yes, are a little on the small side but no smaller than any other chain I've stayed in. The location was excellent with tram stops tourist bus stops and the ferry to downtown Sydney all within walking distance. The restaurant had a fairly limited and rather expensive menu but there are lots of restaurants nearby. Try Robs the breakfast place to the left at the traffic lights it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Ibise Darling Harbour South”
Reviews.Author: ManukaCanberra Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast as it was was excellent. I would have liked the choice of a continental breakfast also. Your Location is ideal for me as I attend meetings and workshops in Kent Street walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great if you are only looking for a bed at night close to lots of attractions. Cleanliness and friendly service was great. We would be happy to stay there again. Found the additional parking expenses a bit high if you are looking for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disspointment for Such great location......”
Reviews.Author: Scgreen13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis with my mum and her partner.. well i didnt end up staying.. Booked a room with two beds.. on check in was told that they over booked this room and were only offered a room with 1 Double bed. How comfortable sleeping with my mother and her partner.... not To fix this we were offered comp parking and Breakfast for two by a very ditsy receptionst who was too busy facebooking on his iphone The Room was unbelievbly small. No towels in the bathroom and toilet was clogged. Coming back from the party i decided to pay the $92 cab ride home instead of sleeping 3 in a bed.... Mother said that she didnt sleep and couldnt wait to check out that coming morning. I was really dissappointed when the Ibis has such a good repuation. I wouldnt stay at this ibis again however i havent given up on the Ibis Chain...

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, small rooms, if traveling with more than one suitcase,”
Reviews.Author: jrupe0
Reviews.Content: good luck, no place to put it, bath very small, small shower, front desk was helpful, breakfast was fine. Would rate 1 or 2 stars in America, similar to a Super 8. Location was good, mall was just out the back door, and coin operated computers in mall. And harbor was just outside of mall area.

Reviews.Title: “crappy service”
Reviews.Author: charlescub
Reviews.Content: would you stay in a business hotel by the airport that 1. forgot your wake up call, 2. charged 16$ to call American Airlines in Sydney from Sydney, 3 offered 30 minutes of free wireless in the lobby and then 10$ per hour ? the room was clean but the t v very small. Am lucky i woke up on my own and made my plane

Reviews.Title: “The room could do with a renovation a little old but clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All staff very polite and helpful. My husband and I had a meal in the restaurant which was excellent. The bed was very comfortable. Good location and access to Darling Harbour and City. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Location for a short stay in Sydney. Room was clean, tidy and adequately fitted out and serviced for our three night stay. Breakfast was good value although supply to clients needs to maintained so no-one misses out! Easy transit to all forms of transport - boats, buses, monorail and rail services. More easly available information as regarding airport transfers would have been good. Larger service desk would be great for check in and out. On the whole good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Servicing Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and although my wife asked the Service Man to service our room he failed to do so and we had to get fresh towels to shower. The front desk staff were informed and were very apologetic and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Poor accommodation and charged premium rates for popular tourist area and”
Reviews.Author: Hatpin44
Reviews.Content: stayed in double room which ws very small. Toilet bowl stained yellow and vanity basin did not drain properly. Did not have bathmat on first night but did on second. Blind had something spilt on it which was not cleaned off and mould had grown on stain. Double room yet only 1 spare pillow provided. Alcohol fridge advised to ask reception desk but then were referred to bar. Only laminated card in room with basic hotel information. No information in room on nearby tourist options. No seating provided in lobby. Access to Harbourside Shopping Centre via carpark ramps. Not a great impression for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “very so so, over priced, good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location....2 min walk to darling harbour. front desk staff not so friendly. just checked me in. no help or directins given, just room keys. had to find lifts and room on own. room was advertised as ''room with a view' view of the street....not the harbour. room was small, but clean-ish. checking out wasnt great either...staff need a bit of customer service or even just to be nice and smile!

Reviews.Title: “weekned stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Being so close to the city is great. Service was very good.these two things are very important. The rooms were clean .More room would be nice in the bathroom .

Reviews.Title: “the chair”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: could do with a more comfortable chair in the room to watch tv. hard to sit on bed as it rolls away from wall on castors

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel / Good location”
Reviews.Author: MGlady15
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, decent rooms. Walking distance to many of the Sydney downtown sites. The first room they put us in was on the first floor / handcapped (bathroom flooded after using the shower), but at our request, they were able to move/upgrade us the next day to a higher room overlooking the harbour - much better.

Reviews.Title: “Happy in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great views of Darling Harbour, immediate access to harbourside amenities i ncluding wide-ranging eating experiences, good in-house service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay and slept very well how ever I believe that the pricing of breakfast is astronomical in assosciation with what you actually can get. The eggs were cold and sloppy, the bacon was also cold and the toasting device either under cooked or burnt the toast. So I would recommend that you either reveiw your prices or put measures in place to ensure food satisfaction. Other than that I enjoyed my stay and will plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: adelaidetraveller004
Reviews.Content: Our first impression was that the hall carpet on our floor had a decidedly musty smell as we emerged from the lift. The room was extremely small. There was no comfortable chair or settee to sit on. We had a problem with a tap in the shower that wouldn't turn and it took three days after we reported it, for a repairman to attempt to fix it. There was also a crack in the shower floor. The bathroom and in fact the whole room, needed urgent updating and repairs. There was no free wireless internet. The cleaning left a fair bit to be desired. The lady who did the cleaning actually just rinsed the dirty cups and glasses in the bathroom basin, instead of removing them to be properly washed and replacing with clean items. I watched her do this one morning and was absolutely amazed. We stayed for five nights and at no stage was the room vacuumed or clean sheets put on the bed. On the whole, very disappointed with this hotel, considering what we were charged.

Reviews.Title: “Location to die for”
Reviews.Author: Skis76
Reviews.Content: After 4 weeks travelling around Tasmania and Australia's east coast, we ended our trip in Sydney, and were delighted with the location of this hotel. The rooms are tiny, but with that view over Darling Harbour it really didn't matter - simply stunning. The monorail station, bus stop, and ferry service to Circular Quay are just moments away from the hotel via the rear door, so you are close to all the action as well. Although the rooms are miniscule, they are comfortable enough for a few nights' stay, and in all honesty if you're in Sydney you shouldn't be staying inside much anyway! Reception staff were incredibly courteous and friendly, and the only negative is one which plagues most hotels - the lack of free or even reasonably priced internet access. If McDonalds can offer free WiFi to all its customers, then surely it's time that all hotels do the same. $5 for 30 minutes is unacceptable, and before you pay it I would suggest visiting the Harbourside Shopping Mall which has internet stations at $2 per hour - far more acceptable! Other than that, I highly recommend this hotel, and you won't regret staying here. It's location was absolutely perfect for us, and we got to see Sydney in all it's glory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely staff, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: maj65
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Ibis Darling Harbour. For this stay we booked a Pyrmont View room as there is no difference in the rooms apart from the darling harbour view. We arrived 2 hours before the check in time and were able to check in. The girls on reception were lovely and very helpful about the area and local attractions. These rooms are very small they fit 2 adults max. However if you are spending most of your time sightseeing or out and about that is not a problem. I found the bed to be lumpy and somewhat saggy but my partner thought the bed was very comfortable. They only provide one pillow per person on the bed. There is one pillow on top of the small wardrobe but this had obviously not been used in a while and was very dusty. However when we asked for two more pillows they were provided promptly. There is a small fridge in the room and tea and coffe making facillities. They also provide an iron and ironing board. There is no pool and the Accor run Novotel next door refused to allow use of their pool. Keep this in mind for the hotter summer months and if you are spending more than a couple of days in Sydney. The Ibis is at the lower end of the Accor chain but you cannot beat this particular one for location and price. If catching a later flight you can store your bags in a locker that requires payment ($7 for 24 hours) or in the open storage area for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location close to all public transport links, good room ideal for our stay in Sydney. We have stayed in Ibis before so were aware of space limitations. Staff helpful enjoyed our stay. Only down side was we weren't able to just get continental breakfast, had to have full or rather pay for full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comments on stay at Ibis Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Communication between Advantage Plus and Hotel needs to be improved. Booking via Advantage Plus web site for 2 rooms for 2 nights according to them the free night extended over the 2 rooms. According to hotel staff it covered one room. As the rooms were booked as a special hotel staff offered the room price at the time of booking for the second room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chrisnsteve76
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in this hotel largely due to the fantastic offer we received prior to flying out to Sydney. We stayed at the Ibis Hotel for 4 nights and have to say we were more than happy with our experience. The hotel itself is very clean, staff are friendly and the facilitlties are ok. Remember this is just a bog standard travel motel, if you don't expect to much then you won't be dissapointed. The room is what you would expect to see for a hotel of this standard the world over. We was able to sleep well at night, and we came home to freshly made beds everyday. The location of thi hotel is brilliant. Right on Darling Harbour. You have every sort of ammenity at your disposal. If you want a nice meal, a drink in a trendy bar (or as we found across the road from the hotel, an old fashioned pub/hotel, sorry the name escapes me now), or a night out clubbing until the small hours Darling Harbour is the place to be. As well as this you also have the Maritine Museum, The Sydney Wildlife Centre and the Aquariam, all worth a visit. One thing, don't bother with the Monorail. Those of you who are pivy to the delights of the Central Line in London during rush hour will know exactly what I mean when I say 'cattle class'. You can also take the ferry from Darling Harbour to all the sights as well (Luna Park is good fun if you want to re awaken your inner child). All in all a fantastic stay in a great little hotel in one of our most favourite cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel at good location with perfect breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jessica630
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location and breakfast! It's so convenient.-- fast access to the exhibition centre, iMax, darling harbour and ream station. With a 15 mins walk you can reach central CBD and QVB. The best hotel breakfast I've ever had! The bad thing is the room size and bathroom size. My manager complains about he can not turn his body in the bath cubic. Even small person like myself found it was very very small.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Ibis Pyrmont”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a really good experience here - the location is brilliant - walking distance to everything, and the rooms were really good. The bed/mattress was also really excellent - had the best sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist”
Reviews.Author: mtfromuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis over Christmas but had to relocate for the New Year period (from 29th December) due to the massive hike in prices that all the city centre hotels apply so they can profit from the Sydney New Year celebrations. The room was small and sparsely equipped and you get the general feeling that you get the least possible of everything. We had to live out of our suitcases as there was woefully inadequate storage facilitys in the room. However, it was clean and I did sleep well as the bed was firm, just how I like it, and the location is, of course, fantastic as you just have to roll out of bed to get to Darling Harbour. Ibis provide basic, value accomodation so I suppose it was what I expected, no more and no less.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We love the Ibis and stay there every time we go to Sydney without the kids. It's a shame they don't have family rooms but it gives us an excuse to get away. We love that it's close to everything especially Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Depome
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights, celebrating our wedding anniversary. I'd never been to Sydney before, so we chose this location for a four night sight-seeing trip. The location was great, we did everything 'on foot' and had no issues getting around at all. Only related problem was actually getting to the hotel from the airport! We took the tram from Central Station but it was damn hard to find the tram terminal (no signage from the line we arrived on, and even the station staff didn't know how to get there!) and when we got off underneath the Ibis, there was no signage to get us to it! We had to pay full room rate as we used Accor vouchers to pay for the stay. At $249 per night (via their website) the rooms were very expensive in our eyes. The Brisbane Ibis, practically in the CBD also, has rooms twice the size with two queen beds, for half the price in our experience :-O I have never before faced the problem of paying for the location, but had to suck it up this time. We had just one suitcase between us, and even for four night, we found the room very small for two people. The bathroom was incredibly cramped, if attractive. Definitely a great location, but don't pay prices like this for a night. Breakfast at the bistro was ok but we got there only 30 mins from the end and they weren't quick to replace items, although they did get round to it. Staff were marvellous. Room had a black-out blind that made it very easy to sleep, and the view was great too, even if the window was covered in salt-spray, as one should expect next to a harbour.

Reviews.Title: “one night only”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i was disappointed to pay seven dollars to you to mind our bags while we waited to catch the plane later that evening suzanne

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: den271 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay here over night as we needed to be in the city for family event Easy walk to eateries, shops and into the city itself. Staff were helpful, rooms were small but clean, great views and big enough for 2 people and only staying one night. Breakfast was included in our room rate and there was heaps available to choose from with a wonderful view while eating breakfast. The Coffee was horrible - the only disappointment with the whol;e stay

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for City and attractions”
Reviews.Author: babe33
Reviews.Content: Excellent location overlooking harbour or Pyrmont street area....Room small but adequate for a centre hotel, could do with more storage for personal items and hanging space is restricted. All facilities in good working order in room and includes flat screen TV, small fridge,kettle, iron and hairdryer. Only one chair and 3 pillows, but bed very comfy. No frills room, lifts to all floors,..Dining room spacious and airy, breakfast excellent, with plenty to eat...it was included in our stay. Small sitting area outside bar, with a public pathway in front of the hotel....Staff very helpful and approachable, any issue promptly resolved....Monorail at the end of the street, small convenience shop directly opposite hotel, would recommend for location rather then luxury.....

Reviews.Title: “Business trip in the harbour city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliantly located, right by the Darling Harbour complex, with only a short 10 minute stroll into town. The rooms are clean, but quite small. I was travelling for business, so I really only needed somewhere nice and comfortable to lay my head, so it was great for that. Breakfast was included in my rate, which was a nice addition, plus it was one of the better buffett breakfast I have had in a hotel for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Eagles concert”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis because of its proximity to the concert venue. We have no complaints about the accommodation except we found the room small. Good service. Excellent location and access to the mon rail. An enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Bliss”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeViews Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service standards & delivery ... are fantastic - especially at the Front Desk. Location is great - within walking distance to key landmarks/attractions - such as the Sydney Fish Market, Sydney Darling Harbour, the Maritime Museum, the Aquarium, monorail station etc. Be mindful of the 24-hr convenience store just opposite the hotel. Their prices are exorbitantly high - be warned! So, do compare prices before you grab something from the store.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: small rooms but comtable very handy to darling harbour city shopping center great resturant at hotel and also at harbour area monorail at back of motel great to get around on

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small and very sparsely furnished. Towels were also very thin

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would recommend a stay at the Ibis Darling Harbour as the location is fantastic and you are so close to the City for work purposes. The room is clean and and has everything you need for a short visit. Great Brekfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: traveller_82_11 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked online and paid up front. The rooms were reasonable, good location, but not great value for money. The service prior and after the stay wasn't fantastic- I sent an email enquiry that was never responded to, and my card seemed to be mysteriously debited as soon as I collected my key. I was not told this would happen. I rang the hotel and asked about this after my stay and I was told that my card was not debited. (I can see from other reviews that this is a common thing, but I was never told that there was a $50 deposit held, in fact I was told it wasn't!). If you need a hotel that's cheaper than others in Darling Harbour, then this is a good location, but if you have a bigger budget, another hotel may be the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location for exploring the CBD area. Light rail, monorail and harbour ferries right at your doorstep. Shower dripped and found the hand basin inadequate for shaving. Bed very comfortable and the room had a view to die for (Darling Harbour Outlook) which was at an additional cost but well worth it !!. Found breakfasts very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Could not sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie3107Sydney Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for $199 through last minute.com and the room was awful. There were no curtains in the room - only 2 see through blind panels that shut out NO LIGHT!! It was so bad that we had to put the blanket up over the blinds in order to block out the light. I'll never stay here again. I'll pay the extra 30-40 dollars and get a queen sized bed (instead of a double) and curtains that actually block out the light.

Reviews.Title: “just the job for the seasoned traveller”
Reviews.Author: oldguylondon
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel NOT the Ritz - but when travelling to a fab city like Sydney you are not surely looking to spend your time gazing at the inside of your hotel. Right on Darling Habour - efficient, very friendly, nice breakkers if you want it (or why not drop down a few steps to a habourside cafe for the bacon and eggs) and surrounded by great restaruants on the habour (or the Sky Tower, Opera Bar) for dinner - you really could not ask for more. But if you travel to spend your time wondering at the inside of your hotel and ignore the exciting city life outside - this might not be for you - but who owns up to that!!!.

Reviews.Title: “IBIS Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room 1022 had no blind forced to put blanket up to block out lights to sleep. Continued noise at night from some machine outside the room. Over priced for size of what was to be a upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis- Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Room was clean enough, the staff were very helpful, when we arrived four hours late after flight was diverted - but the room was barely adequate for two of us. This was disappointing. No drawers for clothing and the wardrobe was tiny.. The View was stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel appeared tired and in need of service to carpets, electrical, no of power points considering C-paps, mobile phones etc., and size of rooms small. We were travelling with our family and asked for two rooms which were on different floors.. No real issue but would have helped with our communication.. We have stayed at better Mercure / Accor hotels and were a little disappointed. We talked to others and they also were just a little disappointed. We did experience some shortage of linen which again no real issue but not the standard we would expect for our money. A small error in original charges which did not go our way added to the disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A good central location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for leisure stay. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Tired”
Reviews.Author: Skidofsky
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Sunday morning and asked if it was possible to get checked in early. The reception staff were very accommodating and we were in our room by around 10 am. We were disappointed in our room as it was small. However, the noise was the main bone of contention for us. We could hear the neighbouring rooms sneeze/cough during the middle of the night which woke us. The other room we could hear laughing. The room seemed to shake when someone closed their door . We did think of complaining at the time but the reception always seemed busy and we were trying to enjoy our holiday. I would not stay at this hotel again. We stayed there as we read that Darling Harbour was the area to stay in. It is good for bars and restaurants etc but would not necessary believe that we would have to stay in this area again. The room itself was clean although it look tired. The bathroom could probably have a done with a deep clean and there were a few areas that were missed. Overall, I would not pay to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Small Rooms, noisy, no room service”
Reviews.Author: moses70
Reviews.Content: The room was very basic and small as too was the bathroom, cleaning could be improved, most concerning was the noise coming from the hall way. I could here other room doors opening and closing and the TV and other guest voices from the room next to me, i wasnt impressed at all. The breakfast was not tastey nor did it look appealing, My tip is to stay in another hotel. The reception staff were helpful and friendly. I have since told several friends my experience, all of which had the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “WELL APPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: tridish Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pros: The room was all that we needed and the were very helpful with everything that we asked. It was close to all the shopping, the cafes, sightseeing, etc. It was easy to find by car and the trains were nice and close when we needed to use them. Cons: The beds were very creaky (seemed like the base had broken boards??) but reasonably comfortable. The roller blind in our room was broken (couldnt be put down or up). Prices in the restuarant were a bit expensive for what we received (we were not asked if we were Accor/A-Club members) hence we recieved no discount. (Will know next time to ask) but will probably not eat in house if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient”
Reviews.Author: juli17
Reviews.Content: Location: excellent, right at Darling Harbour near the monorail and light rail stations and within easy walking distance to the city center. Rooms: Small and quite utilitarian, but clean. Some have views of Darling Harbour. Breakfast: Basic continental choices, okay to get the day stared but nothing special at all. Service/Atmosphere: Service is friendly, lobby and lounge areas are utilitarian and rarely used while we were there. Even the patio area overlooking Darling Harbour was deserted. Conclusion: We stayed in several Ibis hotels during out visit to Australia (in Melbourne and Brisbane) and this was definitely the least of them. If you are looking for extra amenities, a lounge scene, or any atmosphere, this is not the place. However, if you just need a clean and convenient place to rest your head at night at a reasonable price, this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - sardine size rooms”
Reviews.Author: bilkoa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location close to shops and restaruants. The monorail takes you directly into the City BUT the rooms are so small! we could barely fit 2 people plus luggage in there. Next time we stay at Darling Harbour we will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small noisy and overpriced in a good location”
Reviews.Author: aje71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in June with colleagues for a work function. Problem 1: You have to pay for your room at check in. That means you have to pay again for any room service etc when you check out. Problem 2: Unable to provide you with a receipt for your credit card. Problem 3: The noise from the large screens showing the soccer world cup in Darling Harbour was unbearable = no sleep. The rooms are small and I mean really small and way overpriced. The only thing this place has going for it is its location to Darling Harbour - thats what your paying for. Now I don't mind paying for a small room - they are only for sleeping in - but the price should reflect this. Would I stay here again? Only as a last resort. I would stay on the other side of town, get better accommodation for a lower price and catch a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Donna087
Reviews.Content: We travelled with extended family and friends and booked adjoining two bedroom apartments. Each had an ensuite and bathroom and the living areas were quite roomy and comfortable for getting together. The best thing about the apartments though is the location in Darling Harbour with access to the Sky Rail also close by. We also found our rooms to be clean, quiet for a city location and the beds extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: landmark2010
Reviews.Content: Great find in the heart of Sydney. Easy friendly check in and just steps away from Darling Harbour precinct. Rooms aren't overly big but everything you need is there. Great views across the harbour as well. Easy access to everything with trains, buses and the monorail all close by. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “What a noisy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NW28
Reviews.Content: We needed some last minute accommodation due to some changes in plans we had made, and were booked into the Ibis by our travel arrangers. Good points: - Location is a very short walk from Darling Harbour (make sure you find out about the back entrance so you don't have to cross at the nearby intersection). - The shower is quite good. Not so good points: - Very basic rooms which are quite poky with the absolute bare essentials supplied. - Our view from the ninth floor was into nearby apartments so nothing special there. - Our accommodation was prepaid by our travel organisers but we still had to leave a credit card imprint for any incidentals. - Breakfast was quite ordinary - had it not been included I would have been more than happy to go elsewhere. - Staff don't go out of their way to assist - we had a huge amount of luggage and had to seek & use the trolleys ourselves (although perhaps we should be grateful that these were supplied). This is one of the noisiest hotels I have ever stayed in. You can hear every noise from the hallway, including slamming doors, lifts dinging, people talking, walking, vacuuming, everything! I don't think I would stay here again under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “a disgrace”
Reviews.Author: wahebe
Reviews.Content: We booked on line expecting to get harbour views we arrived at the hotel Ibis and were told we were at the wrong 1 we were sent to the other Ibis in Shelley St. once we arrived we were told to drived 600 metres up the road to garage the car. When we finally arrived back at the hotel we were told they were over booked and they offered us to go back to the other Ibis as it was where we originally thought we were staying so we agreed to go and 2 hours after first arriving at our hotel we were back where we started. Excited we had finally arrived and had got our harbour views dissapointment set in when we opened the door and saw the room it was no bigger than the lift a bed with no bed spread and a gap of less than 25 centremetres between the wall and the bed and the views outstanding if you like concrete jungles. Thankyou Ibis for an charging us to stay in this shoe box and a promise to myself never to book on line again...one word DISGRACEFUL>>>

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not as bad as other reviews made it seem!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaL65
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews after booking and was a bit dubious...but honestly when we arrived it wasnt so bad! Yes we had to leave our bags in a room with many others for an hour...but the service was good, very friendly...and our room on 10th (top) floor was fine. Smallish maybe..but certainly liveable. Everything that we needed was there. On our second morning, early departure meant we couldnt eat at restaurant so they arranged "breakfast boxes" which I picked up from reception. Very nice. And the location of the hotel right on Harbourside shoping centre and Darling Harbour with ferry connections only 10 min walk, make the whole expreience fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and too many problems - avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: CFSurrey
Reviews.Content: I selected the Ibis Darling Harbour because of its convenient location for my business meetings. As I had a 7am arrival after an overnight flight, I called the hotel to ask if they could provide early check-in. The answer was no, so I agreed to make the reservation to start from the day before. They took my details but suggested that I book on their web site as that offered a cheaper rate. I booked the pre-pay rate for 5 nights on the Accor web site. So on arrival, I experienced the following: 1. I didn't have a reservation! After a 10 minute delay and the clerk disappearing into the manager's office, they found my reservation but said that check-in was from 14:00! 2. I showed my copy of the reservation confirming arrival the day before and explained about the phone call. After another 5 minute trip to the manager's office I was told, 'there are no rooms available at present but I could change in the lobby toilets'! 3. I said this was completely unacceptable as I had pre-paid for the room, with their knowledge, to guarantee early check-in. Another 5 minutes away with the manager and I was offered a room to change in, but I would have to change rooms later as there was 'a problem with the shower'. I accepted this under protest. 4. When I returned later in the day, I was told that I could stay in the room after all. On the first 2 nights the hotel was extremely noisy from midnight with people shouting in the corridors and banging doors. I (and other guests as we came out into the corridor to see what was going on) called the front desk to ask them to intervene, but nothing was done and the noise continued until 3 am. The restaurant in the evening was a further disaster, with just one girl serving and attempting to cover 20 tables! I arrived early and had a slow dinner with disappointing food. Most other people who followed me didn't stay but left when they were either not seated or seated but then abandoned. I complained in writing to Accor about these problems, to which the reply from the front desk manager "I am sorry to read that your experience did not meet your expectations. It is disappointing to read your comments and it is clear that we have let you down in a number of areas across our operation. As a fairly new management team currently operating in this hotel we have a strong focus on guest service and we really do value your feedback. We hope to see some major changes with some of the wonderful new staff we have hired and the training courses we have put in place. I do hope that you will return and note these changes yourself in the near future." The IBIS offer a '15 minute satisfaction promise' which they claim that if they can't sort your problem with 15 minutes, your night's stay is free. Apparently this does not apply to problems with reservations... The hotel itself is tired and in need of refurbishment. The room carpets are stained, and the walls scuffed. My window was so dirty (on the outside) that when the sun was on it, it was impossible to see out. The bedding and bathrooms are clean, although there was a musty smell in my bathroom if I left the fan off. On several days only 1 of the 3 elevators was working, resulting in queues and delays. Even teabags are not replenished in the rooms - you have to ask for more at the front desk. I witnessed several other guests complaining about problems with their reservations, and rooms not being cleaned. If you have a choice, stay elsewhere! I won't be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and view”
Reviews.Author: DanfromAus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis Darling Harbour for two nights in a harbour view room in June and loved it. I was greeted at check in by a lovely young lady (wish I could remember her name) who made me feel extremely welcome and was given a room on the 10th (top) floor. The room was good, not very big but more than enough for a solo traveller for a few days. Bed was good. The bathroom was small but not tiny and very clean and the TV was quite small, but what a view! Thats the reason I booked this room and was not disappointed. I would recommend trying to get a room on a high floor. The only problem I had was the walls seemed to be a bit thin and I could hear doors closing a lot, but it wasn't enough to wake me, a minor inconvenience. Also no real room service but so many food options so close that it didnt matter to me. The location is fantastic. Lots of restaurants and bars close by. Also very close to Star City. The monorail and ferry, as well as the tram line to central are all within a few mins. As a frequent traveller to Sydney and a former Sydney resident I was a little apprehensive paying the same amount for a 3 star room when a lot of secret 5 star deals are only slightly more, but it was well worth it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was at a hot spot of Sydney, perfect eye tonic , lovely view of Darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: JyotiSingh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was functional, staff very hospitable and helpful, superbly located as the hotel overlooks darling Harbour, economical and central to other locations of Sydney. Quite the place to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Small room in a good location”
Reviews.Author: eddotcom
Reviews.Content: If Ikea were to design a hotel room, it would probably come out a lot like our Ibis room. It was small and Spartan, with starkly modern styling. Our travel agent said that the hotel was completely refurbished in 2007. We would not have guessed that any major maintenance too place that recent. The room Our room was about 166 square feet, including the bath. Every square inch is put to good use. A bulit-in desk is situated in front of the window, and is sandwiched between a bench on one side, and a door-less closet on the other. Bed The Queen sized (60" x 80") bed was on rollers, and would scoot across the room if bumped. This may have been a good thing since in its normal location, there is only an 14" passage on the side nearest the wall. The mattress was of medium firmness, but comfortable. Bedding includes a bottom sheet which pulled out when the very light comforter sandwiched between two sheets was untucked. There is no bed spread. An additional blanket was provided, as well as a total of three bed pillows, and two small decorative pillows. Bath We were supplied with 2 good sized (30"x55") light weight bath towels, two wash cloths and a bath mat. There were no hand towels since, as the houskeeper advised, this is a 3 star, not a 4 star hotel. (If we were awarding the stars, we might not be quite so generous.) There is a shower, with a very good shower head and sufficient water stream. There is no tub. For some unknown reason, a digital timer was affixed to the shower wall. Shampoo, conditioner, and two extremely small bars of soap were provided. The sink is free-standing, without a counter. Toiletries can be placed on a nearby shelf unit. Power Australian power is 220 V with angled socket slots like so: \ / The bath power outlet has one 110 V. socket for US style plugs, but it did not accept polarized or 3 pronged plugs. We could find only one other power source in the room--a 220 V Australian style socket on the desk. All outlets are switched, so one has to be sure that the outlet is turned on when charging batteries. Fortunately, we had packed a multiple plug adapter in addition to Australian to US plug adapters. Since all of our electronic devices can operate on 110 to 240 V, we did not need a power converter. Room lights may be turned off from a switch above the built-in nightstand--a nice touch, even though we felt as if we could probably touch any part of the room from bed. A/C The single solid pane window did not open even a crack. Fortunately the air conditioning system worked well. The analog thermostat provided excellent temperature control for both heating and cooling. The fan had three settings and was reasonably quiet on the lowest speed setting. Amenities There are no ice machines on any floor, but ice is available from the bar. The room had a tiny refrigerator, an iron, ironing board, and a coffee maker with coffee, tea, and ceramic cups. A combination phone and clock radio did not function to call our friends in a nearby room. It was able to connect to the front desk, and two days and two repair requests later, it became fully functional. A 20" flat panel (not HD) television was affixed to the wall opposite the bed. As small as the room was, it still managed to make the television appear miniscule. Location The hotel's strongest feature is its location adjacent to Darling Harbor. If one exits the hotel from the harbor side and turns right, the Harbourside Shopping Center is a very short walk down a ramp and through the parking garage. The center contains food court with a good assortment of fast food restaurants (including McDonald's). Many full service restaruants line Darling Harbor. If one turns to the left when exiting the rear of the hotel, a monorail stop is a short walk away, and a stop for the hop-on hop-off bus is just a bit farther. Luggage storage before check-in If you arrive before your room is ready, you may leave your luggage in an unlocked, unsecure luggage room. You may chose to put your luggage in a locker for $7 for 24 hours. The locker will hold 2 carry-on bags, plus a couple of smaller bags.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: suzytony
Reviews.Content: All you can say about this hotel is that it is clean and well situated for the sights and sounds of Darling Harbour. In every other way it is an average functional hotel that provides a box room with a bed for the night.
