Head to Darling Harbour for Breakfast where you can get the works for between $9 - $12 - the hotel charges $18 for a buffet style breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: EssexSenior
Reviews.Content: I should imagine that the complaints department dealing with this hotel are rushed off their feet! I have had a similar reply from them as posted by your other reviewers, leaving me with the distinct impression that they will not do very much to improve things. It is a miserable, depressing hotel, with small, dingy rooms, poor service and indifferent staff. The price they are charging is much too high and it can hardly qualify as a 3*. It should be looked at by the Australian Tourist Board. It is not a good advertisement for Sydney. Our experience was poor from beginning to an end which could not come soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “You Have Got To Be Kidding!”
Reviews.Author: gryphonisle
Reviews.Content: We spent our final night here, having had to bounce around and pay high rated thanks to Mardi Gras which began the night before we left. We paid $279.00 for this room and it is not that category hotel in any way, sense, or form. We make fun of Airport Hyatts and Holiday Inns as bland, colorless corporate style, but Ibis makes the Holiday Inn seem thoughtful and luxurious! I'd call this "Hotel By Ikea". And that's still an insult to Ikea. We arrived knowing check-in was a few hours off, and wanted to drop off our luggage. We were directed to an unsecured room just off the lobby, where all the lockers were full and over a hundred bags were crowding the floor. Nothing happened, no one took our stuff, but what an experience! I would not want to pay a penny over $60.00 for this room, or this hotel. The location was nice enough, especially if you were in town for a convention as the convention center is just down the road. The monorail stops in front of the hotel as does the tram, and the maritime museum is just a block away. If you had a room on the city side, you'd have a great view of the skyline, and the CBD is a short and pleasant walk. Still, this setting is a bit too bland for my tastes, I'd have preferred Kings Cross, where we started. But, again, the setting is not the issue here. This is a budget hotel and we paid way too much for a room I would not have wanted even at a proper rate.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely shocking!!”
Reviews.Author: L2TBug101
Reviews.Content: We made a very bad decision in choosing to stay here. Even though the hotel is in a great location don't stay here. It's just not worth the disappointment and it's not value for money. We wanted to leave after 5 mins in the room but we had prepaid our accommodation. We booked directly via hotel website for 'stay 4 pay 3 nights' deal in a superior queen bed harbour view room. I'd read the TA reviews beforehand but still booked here thinking it couldn't really be that bad for an Ibis Hotel (being part of the Accor Group). Here's the good stuff. The hotel reception area looked pleasant, clean, well maintained and vibrant. Lots of tourist information/brochures available. Three computers are available for internet access (there are charges). Lounge area with TV to the right of reception. Locker room (charges apply). In our experience the staff were pleasant. There is a hotel policy that if you have a problem it will be fixed in 15 mins or your nightsâ€™ accommodation is free (thatâ€™s laughable). There is a taxi rank right outside the hotel and easy access to Darling Harbour, shopping centre, light rail and monorail, ferry to Balmain/Luna Park/Circular Quay and easy walking distance to Star City. Hotel is in a great location which makes it a shame to say that the room we had (814) was absolutely shocking. Ok so hereâ€™s the ugly stuff!! Upon check-in we had to pay a fee of $50. This was not mentioned at the time of booking. Apparently it's for any charges that you may accrue during your stay (not charged to the credit card but held). Iâ€™ve never encountered this before at a hotel so was a bit apprehensive about it. Both electronic key cards didnâ€™t work even after several attempts. Back to reception and all sorted. Opened the door to the room to be smacked in the face with the most awful stank. Tried to open the window for fresh air but doesnâ€™t open. At this time I did notice the view over Darling Harbour but I was trying hard not to throw up in my hands from the smell. I canâ€™t even describe the smell because Iâ€™ve never smelted anything like it. Even my husband had a hard time dealing with the smell. The room is very small and would not be suitable for long stays not that you would want to even stay here anyway. We found it hard for 4 days with 2 small suitcases having to shuffle around. There is a small hanging closet. Has a mini-fridge that contains milk for the tea/coffee, and of course the kettle. Walls are thin and you can hear the doors slamming shut which was a bit annoying particularly late at night or in the early hours of the morning. LCD TV on the wall is small and not in a good position - glare from the sun and room lights. The afternoon sun blared into the room and blinds werenâ€™t block out (for two days of our stay the temperature was 35c). The carpet was damp and sticky and felt awful. So much so that we wore shoes the whole time in the room. Pulled back the bed covers and the sheet was dirty. Had some sort of sticky stain that looked like the residue of chewing gum. Bed covers consist of a sheet, doona (with no cover) and another sheet on top. Apart from that the bed was comfortable. We woke up in the early hours of the morning to find that the toilet had leaked in the very small bathroom. Hubby used the towels to mop it up. He decided to wait until morning to ring reception which he did at 7am, to be told that the â€˜engineerâ€™ didnâ€™t start work until 8am and what did we want him to do about it (remember I said earlier about the 15 mins fix policy being laughable, we didn't receive a free night's accommodation). Housekeeping barged into the room just before one of us had time to open the door (remembering it is a small room). We exchanged the sopping towels for new ones so we could have a shower and go out for the day. We had assumed that someone would return later to clean the room and hoped the sheets would be changed and the toilet leak fixed. Come back late in the afternoon and no sign that anyone had been in the room to clean it or to check the toilet leak. Fortunately we didn't have any more issues with the toilet leaking. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: suefromCalif
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel by DownUnderAnswers. The room on the first floor smelled like ramen noodles as did the hallway. The window was 1/3rd obstructed by a metal beam that held up the outside awning. Asked to be moved but nothing was available until the next day. The room on the 6th floor had a better odor and a clear view, but towels were in short supply. One day no towels, a call to reception brought nothing and a second call brought towels after 1 hour. Normally we were left 1 towel for 2 people. Ironically there was a large sign stating that if you had a problem, the staff would resolve it within 15 minutes. Nothing was ever resolved even after complaining to reception. Teeny rooms! Good location but we would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent - rooms TINY”
Reviews.Author: LowrieJ
Reviews.Content: We wanted a central location in Sydney and were not disappointed with location. Could not be better. However, the rooms left a lot to be desired. Our first night was disturbed by a noisy air con system. The room was so small we had to walk over our suitcases and live out of them because the 'wardrobe' housed the ironing board! We were moved to a quieter room on the 10th floor but the size of the room was the smallest we have ever been in!!! Beds were comfy and rooms were satisfactorily clean. Bathroom was functional and clean but again minute!! Breakfast was good especially the pancakes!! Staff were pleasant. Knowing other better hotels in the same location we would stay in the better hotel next time. We always use IBIS in Europe and the rooms are considerably larger. Size of rooms in this hotel are a BIG down point. However, location does make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was in a prison - small box rooms & prison like corridors!”
Reviews.Author: wilks100
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the evening before Australia Day with my husband. We were thoroughly disappointed with the room! The corridors before you reach your room make you feel like you are in a prison.. dark and metal door frames.. The room was the tiniest we had ever stayed in and we have stayed in many hotels throughout our lives.. The shower was small (no bath) as was the rest of the bathroom. You have to squeeze past one another as you walk around the bed area.. As the hotel has other hotels with balconies looking into it, you have to keep the roller blind closed.. this makes the room even more box like!! Louvre or slat blinds would have been better as at least they would have allowed privacy and let light in!! We payed $200 for one night! And then had to pay $30 parking fees on top (we thought this was included) - we left early morning and did not eat breakfast here which would have added another $40 on to the cost!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms & service!”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer0101
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience I have had in a long time. Rooms are tiny and not clean! Help from reception for any matter is non-existent. Would not recommend staying in the hotel. Search for better Sydney hotels on the net.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Darling Harbour at the end of December 2009. It was in many ways a mixed experience (both in terms of service and quality of the room). To summarize for those of you who do not want the details; good location, clean, reasonably comfortable, decent value but do not expect anything special (neither from the room nor from the staff). Looking at the location it is however a rather central location at Darling Harbour. It is easily walkable across the bridge to the CBD. There is also easy access to the monorail and the tram (personally I prefer walking but from what I understood it was 2-3 stops from the central station). It is however not the best location since it is sort of on the edge of the central parts of the city so while Chinatown and the CBD are close it is a bit further to Circular Quay, Paddington and Kings Cross but it is still a good location. We had the standard room, with the so called City view. Not an exciting view facing the street but we did not select the hotel based on the view. We had a queen size bad that was reasonable comfortable. The room was equipped with LCD-TV (not great quality but still ok) with a sufficient number of channels. The standard things were available (iron, water kettle, hair dryer). The bathroom was also ok, no tub but a shower. The overall impression was that everything that should be there was there and it was clean. It could have been less noisy (no noise from the street but from people out in the corridors) Most of the furniture etc felt a bit cheap (as usual at Ibis hotels) but worked as expected. The service experience was sort of mixed. We arrived early in the morning (7 am) so we did not expect the room to be ready (specifically considering it was such a busy time of the year) but we could check in at once. There were however some other parts of the service that was not as good. They managed to miss handing messages to us (a change in pick-up time for a tour - we received the message two days later when we checked out) and there was also a general lack of knowledge of rather basic information about Sydney. The personnel at the front desk were never rude although not very friendly either. Cleaning staff were slightly disorganized and showed up at odd times (one day they opened the door at our room around 7.30 am. We should of course have put the 'do not disturb'-sign up but still did not expect cleaning that early. The day after we got back to our hotel room at 3pm and they still had not been there).

Reviews.Title: “very disorganised hotel, with unsympathetic staff”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes2507
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the V8 supercars weekend. We had arranged when we booked that we would be checking in at 7am after an overnight flight from Perth so we were quite happy to pay for the previous night, so we could go straight to bed. We got there and they had given our rooms away and were very rude about it saying we should have checked in the night previously, although we were in a diff state! Over 2 hours later they had 2 rooms available and credited us the night that we didn't stay. The buffet breakfast was crap, stale food, not all available and staff have bad hygiene habits like running hands through hair then touching food and handling utensils by food end.Rooms were tiny and hotel was very very noisy so good luck sleeping past 6am, our room was cleaned once in the 4 days and even then we had to ask with a rude response. We used the credit to keep one room as a late check out as we have a night flight but when we had got back to our room we had been locked out so it took another hour to sort that out. Also had sign advertising throughout hotel about happy hours in the bar and bar wasn't even open on some nights stated. An overall dissatisfying experience and would not stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “good value, helpful staff, clean rooms, excellent position”
Reviews.Author: ctaylor59
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a week in Sydney and must say we thought the Ibis was a top place to stay. i had read some of the reviews and quite frankly was a little hesitant having stayed in the next door Novotel last year. however we we pleasantly surprised by what we found. the rooms whilst small by comparison to others were functional, clean and comfortable.the location is incredible. the staff were very nice and helpful.lets face it we werent there to stay in the room all the time so we found our stay a pleasant one. we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Quays, clean, bedroom small.”
Reviews.Author: tiflco
Reviews.Content: The foyer of the hotel was a basic Ibis or similar hotel in its class. The room was a twin one over looking Darling Harbour (if you looked hard) it was small but ok for a base the beds moved across the room though when laid upon them. To get the the Harbour you walk through a shopping centre which has a varied amount of shops, and a food court at the bottom of it. The location is great for all amenties, we took the ferry to Circular Quay for the opera house etc. I would stay here again and had a great time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very average!”
Reviews.Author: TasDevils
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, the room was very small and the bathroom even smaller! Very noisy at night time with doors banging all the time, bar was not open very often. Was generally very clean. BUT it is a very handy spot to stay, just over thr road from Darling Harbour, so handy for the restuarants, shops and ferries. Easy to walk into the city from here, Chinatown not far away. Wouldn't chose to stay again simply because there are many other places to chose from in this area but overall it was reasonable value for money, as we had a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping next to a Washing Machine”
Reviews.Author: Hollybear
Reviews.Content: Didn't sleep a wink. The first night we went to bed and noticed the air con was very noisy so we turned it off. Didn't make any difference to the noise as the vents kept sucking air loudly all night. Next morning rang reception and was told they would send someone up to check air con, waited 25 minutes no one arrived, (by the way there was a card in the room saying "if your problem's not fixed in 15 minutes your room is on us" or words to that effect) we had a conference to go to. Rang again and someone arrived to our room on the 10th floor. They agreed that it was noisy and said they would look into it while we were out. Later that day we got back to the hotel and noticed that the phone message light was on. Tried to retrieve message...nothing, rang reception saying I think there is a message and was told, no, don't worry about it sometimes the light comes on by itself???? Later I rang reception and asked to speak to the guy that was looking into our noise problem and was transferred to him. He told us that he had checked some other rooms and spoken to the engineers who said they are all the same and the building is old and nothing they can do. He then offered us complimentary breakfast for our stay which was a nice gesture but still didn't give us any sleep. So we stayed, breakfast was average but the view in the small room was great. We used the internet in the room 2 nights no problem. Third night it wouldn't work so rang reception who transferred me to their IT company. We spoke for a while, tried a few things and then they said it sounds like the hotel connection cable is no good we will get reception to bring up a new one............waited 1/2 an hour, gave up and went out. Checked out and they wanted to charge me for the call to their Internet supplier because their system didn't work, Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: AMLOVER
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for short stay. We were on the 9th floor and there was no trouble to get rooms next door to each other. The rooms facing the harbour have a great view especially at night. Room was clean and they have made the most out of a small space. Only thing I would say is that the TV is positioned in the wrong place - but hey we were not in Sydney to watch TV. Breakfast was very busy in the morning and they seemed to be short one or two staff but food was good and great value. Would be amazing if guests had access to the roof for the great view but this is not so. Had a great time in Sydney and would stay at the Ibis Darling Harbour again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: fivelaws
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Ibis hotels before, so I know to expect fairly basic small rooms. But I'm afraid this hotel is an embarrassment to the Accor group. My 2x single-bed room was stupidly small, but also in a poor state of decoration; odd looking stain on the carpet, dirty-looking grout in the (INSANELY small) bathroom floor and marks on the walls. The single beds are not sturdy enough for a larger adult, so every movement in the night felt like sleeping on a giant blancmange. After two night of not sleeping, I had to re-arrange the beds so that one of them was jammed up against the wall so I could get a good nights sleep. Wi-Fi. Oh, yes. $20 for 3 hours. If I had wanted internet access for the 10-days I was there, it would have been more expensive than the room!! Despite not normally pre-booking hotel breakfast, preferring local options, I did take up the $15/day option and totally regret it. 1) They had no record of the pre-payment so I had to go fetch my laptop, find the confirmation e-mail and show it to them ("could you e-mail that to me, sir?" - "only if I can get free internet access from somewhere...."). Despite that, they continued to decline me EVERY morning and on Sunday morning, the queue to get into the restaurant was so long I couldn't wait and walked out. Not that all this trouble is even worth it - the breakfast is terrible. Location? Great. Right on Darling Harbour with an awesome view across to the CBD. Short stroll to the conference centre, QVB. Best thing about the place. In summary: Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is over priced not equipped for advanced bookings,”
Reviews.Author: ltar74
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 months in advance and the rooms we booked where not available. When they finally re-arranged some rooms, we got up to the room and it was like a matchbox. Smoking rooms have no ventilation. Service was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean and friendly, but rooms unacceptably small.”
Reviews.Author: Gastr0T0urist
Reviews.Content: We were on a 3 week trip encompassing Singapore, Cairns, Sydney, Coffs Harbour, Sydney again, then Bangkok on our return to U.K. Arrived around 8 a.m. (too soon for access to the room) but no probs. I had read that harbour view rooms were worth the upgrade cost, so we took one of those, they secured our luggage and we returned to check in at noon. I had hoped that the upgrade would have meant a larger room but it was tiny. These rooms are only suitable for a businessperson travelling with minimal luggage and a laptop, totally inadequate for anyone on a 3 week holiday with 2 suitcases and hand luggage. There was hanging space with 4 coathangers only, and no drawers for underwear. We couldn't unpack even one suitcase due to the lack of storage, and had to take it in turns to get around the bed due to our cases taking up most of the floor space. We were not looking forward to our return stay the following week, and decided we would not pay for any upgrade for that stay. On the upside, the location cannot be bettered, staff were fine, breakfast overpriced, so go harbourside. The bar was only open on one ocassion the whole time we were there, which is o.k. if you like bottled beer, but not if you fancy a glass of wine or spirit for a nightcap. Overall, the location doesn't outweigh the discomfort of the room so we would definately not go back. Possibly try the Mercure or Novotel which enjoy the same views.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything - Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Monegeetta
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just stayed at the Ibis for the second time & enjoyed it very much. Some people complain/comment on the size of the rooms, you only sleep in them the rest of the time you are out and about. The rooms are clean, the staff at reception were very helpful, yes the lifts can be a bit slow, at least they stopped correctly. You can walk to the MonoRail or into the city and the food court is only a 10 minute stroll from the motel. We have now stayed in rooms on both sides of the hotel & yes the Darling Harbour side is good but for how long you stare out the window. Would we return to the Ibis, definetly yes.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking View”
Reviews.Author: Coj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Darling Harbour for 3 nights while visiting Sydney during a holiday to Brisbane, to be truthful we booked the Ibis because it was reasonably cheap. Upon arrival we were shown to a twin room (unfortunately there were three of us including my 8 year old daughter), after a trip back to reception a porter arrived with a zed bed but the room was so small that the bed could not be fully extended, after much discussion and being told that the hotel had no triple rooms we suggested they may give us a room with a King or Queen sized bed, they agreed and gave us a room on the top floor, the view was breathtaking and we slept with the blinds open each night, it was truly worth the squeeze. Although the rooms were small they were clean and functional, breakfast was good and the hotel is in a great location, all the main attractions are within easy walking distance. Darling harbour is a beautiful area and there is no shortage of bars and restaurants, a good place to stay if you want to use public transport. If you want a better standard of room go to the Novotel next door, if you want a decent cheap room then the Ibis will do.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, convenient, but get a harbour view”
Reviews.Author: australiaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis for a conference. The conference centre is just a short walk away, the monorail is close, so too is the casino, maritime museum and Lyric Theatre. It is located in a great position. It is just a short walk across the Pyrmont Bridge to the city. I was concerned about previous reviews re: room size, however my room was fine considering I was in Sydney. You can't expect a palace for $200 (or a little less) a night in Sydney and a basic breakfast was included. I would recommend though that you do get a harbour view and ask specifically for a room on floor 8 or above. If you did not have a harbour view, it would feel quite grungy. The reception staff were adequate, but not overly friendly in manner. It was great to see the hotel employed Indigenous staff. I would certainly stay again, but would need to stipulate a harbour view and a high floor to stay on. The Hotel/Pub just down the road at the end of the bridge is a great place to go for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mountainview547
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the IBIS Darling Harbour for a Conference in August 2009. The price of the room was $179 for a Darling Harbour view and this can have been the only reason for paying so much. The rooms are incredibly small with no adequate storage space, the only cupboard being a piece of wood in the corner with hangers that also contained the ironing board and iron - so used clothing has to be stored on the floor as this is the only space left and clean clothes just piled up next to the iron as there are no drawers. The shower room is minute but actually quite serviceable with lots of hot water but of course the soaps and shampoos are not of the highest quality. There are not enough power points so one is constantly unplugging and plugging to charge phones and use the computer. This is all well and good and would be tolerable if it were not for the noise! One wonders if the IBIS rents rooms by the hour as the noise in the corridors and constant slamming of doors all night long means sleep is impossible. The staff are actually the best part of this excuse for a hotel and if it were not for their politeness and helpfulness the whole episode would be utterly hopeless. Oh and only two out of three lifts work so in peak periods one waits an age for a lift. If it were not for the fact that my company booked me in here I would not even consider staying here again - there are many better deals available in this part of Sydney that at least offer some semblance of comfort to the weary traveler rather than what feels like an up-market hostel. The view is fantastic but of course is there anyway whether you are in the IBIS or not and that is the point.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel for a brillant city”
Reviews.Author: Macmcginn
Reviews.Content: After a long haul flight, we were very tired yet excited about being in Syddney. On arrival at the hotel at around mid morning we found that we had to join a very long que at reception to check in as ther was only one member of staff on the desk! After a lenghty wait (30mins) we were greeted by the less than friendly receptionist with a"Yes" . We stated that we wished to check in and gave her our names, to which she replied that could not find booking, we presented our confirmation details and they were taken and she left the reception area and went into a room at the back and then came out to say that it was ok!! She presented us with our room key and then proceed to ask the next person in line what did they want. We had to ask what floor room was on and were lifts where. They did have 3 lifts but it appeared that after a 10 minute wait that only 2 worked. The main corridors of the hotel are dull and grimey and the carpet stained, so we did not hold much hope on the room. The room, well what can I say, it was a shoe box, that overlooked the main road, 2 people could not pass by one another and so my husband had to sit on the bed if I wanted to pass to go to the bathroom or vice versa. The wardrobe had only enough room for you to hang 2-3 items of clothing and had no door! and the ironing board and iron had to be storted in it also so then it left no room for your clothesand as there was no drawers we had to keep our clothes in our suitcases, that we had to stack ontop of on one another on a chair as there was no room for them anywhere else!!! The general cleaniness of the room was ok. Again the bathroom was clean but very very small, you could stand and touch the walls with both arms outstreteched, and after a long fligh I was looking forward to a bath and there was none, just a shower cubicle which was very small as my husband learned when trying to shower as he is 6ft 4 and the showerhead was too low and he could just about turn in it. It did have tea and coffee making facilities and a small fridge, the air con was very noisey and when we tried to turn if off it was broken. We went to reception to report the fault and they advised us they will have it checked out. We deceided to escape the confines of the room and whilst at reception again joined the que to ask the receptionist about safety deposit box, things to do,restaurant times etc and we were pointed to a large display in a corner of the main entrance that held leaflets for things to do, the restaurant /bar did not open until 6pm and had a very limited menu and again service very slow and had only one staff member that did the orders, bar and served the food!! The cost was very expensive for a meal for 2 people and 2 drinks considering it was only burger and chips and fish and chips ($90). On a good note the safety deposit box was free and was in a room behind the reception area but you had to carry a large key around with you and ask at reception to access it as they also had a key and you had to fill out a form each time. Our air con problem was not sorted out, they sent the person cleaning the rooms to look at it and he told us that we needed to report it again to reception as he said that it was broke and sounded like a toilet cistern filling up!!! So I went back to reception and reported it again, now 10.30pm and was told by the receptionist that he would be up in 10 mins to have a look, after a 20 min wait they phone rang and it was reception asking if the air con was ok, i advised no and was told that would be up in 10 mins, after a further 15 mins wait they rang up again and asked the same question, then after a further 10 mins the receptionist came up to the room and stood on end of the bed and took the grill of the air con and started to poke at it with his pen, he then asked if anyone had flushed the toilet as he said it sounded like a cistern filling up! I advised no to which he replied that air con broken and that a main water pipe serving the hotel must run through this room and so he would move us in the morning to another room, no apologies given and told us to enjoy the rest of our night which at this stage was now into the early morning!!! The following morning we asked at reception and were moved to another room, with air con that worked, but beside the fire escape that had work men using it as maintenance was being carried out on the stair well, it was just as well that in Sydney there was lots for us to do during the day. The hotel is ideal location wise to the city centre which is a ten minute walk from the hotel over the darling harbour bridge, you can also access the city/darling harbour/mono rail and the aquarium/wildlife world etc via the back of the hotel. There is a very good shopping centre /bowling alley and lots of restaurants/bars around the darling habour area that cater for all tastes and pockets and can be accessed from the back entrance of the hotel and across the footbridge. The pyrmount hotel which is down the road from the Ibis hotel offers excellent food and drink at a very reasonable cost and the staff are very friendly and helpful and it is opened 24 hrs. A Thursday night was excellent as you can join in the crab racing for $4 a crab and the have such a good laugh and make new friends!!!!! The ibis had a vending machine in the hotel entrance if you got the muchies but the price was almost double that of the supermarkets nearby, the supermarket across from the hotel is very expensive and the staff are not friendly, I would use the Seven11 at the corner of the street as it is open 24 hrs and the staff are very friendly and it is much cheaper. When checking out we asked if the hotel would store our luggage and we were advised that they could not and that we could put our luggage in a locker for $7 in a room at the side of the hotel reception, the lockers will just about hold 1 small suitcase and only takes coins and the machine to get coins was broken and reception staff were not very nice when you asked for change. This hotel is very disappointing for the money we paid and the fact that it is in a brillant city like Sydney leaves at lot to be desired, it was the start of our trip around Australia and as first time visitors to the country the hotel, service and the unfriendly staff made us think had we done the right thing in coming to Australia!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: squidgybutt
Reviews.Content: Started my Ibis experience with rude staff who had a poor command of English, combined with attitude because I don't have a credit card. Once I was finally booked in I then had to park my car in the carpark of the hotel next door, then lug my bags out of the carpark and across the front of the Novotel to get back into the Ibis. To add insult to injury, you have to pay to park there (that's why I ticked no to parking further down). Finally got to a room that was so small you had to go outside to change your mind (which was supposedly a Family room). The location was good, the view was nice, and breakfast was alright (if you discount the staff), but I would suggest you stay next door at the Novotel, and give this place a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Sydney Shopping Trip”
Reviews.Author: Christine061
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews of this hotel it was with trepidation that we arrived at the hotel. We were in Sydney for a long weekend of shopping, dining with a bit of sightseeing. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Yes the rooms are smallish but we both had two large suitcases and we were not tripping over them in the room. Neither were we tripping over one another in the room. Wardrobe was big enough for two women staying a long w/end with the assorted clothing required. The room had tea/coffee making facilities and a bar fridge - essential for the gin & tonic after a hectic day shopping. Using the monorail was great for getting around Sydney and was a 3minute walk from the hotel. Only downside was that the hotel room doors were heavy and slammed shut - not a lot of consideration given by other guests arriving/departing early/late. We didn't pay for an upgrade to 'harbour view' but our view on the other side was OK. One bonus was a small supermarket across the road where you could get essentials, snacks etc. Reception staff were always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you want comfort"”
Reviews.Author: bookmarks42
Reviews.Content: Other than its superb location and if the pay the extra, its beautiful views of darling harbour, do not stay here if your looking for something comfortable. The rooms are TINY, far too small for two people. The beds are rock hard, and the bathroom is pretty squeezy aswell. It was clean though and it had looked like it had been renovated recently. We had orginally booked it for three nights in a darling harbour room (which you pay extra for the view - worth it) we ended up cancelling the last two nights and stayed in a classier hotel in the buisness district. The breakfast was also pretty average, although i wold recommend that you go to a local cafe for breakfast - it would be much cheaper. Its close to all the local attractions including darling harbour, the aquarium, casino, IMAX and lots of shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “excellent view”
Reviews.Author: saleem42
Reviews.Content: good stay..but rooms quite small..good view and good service

Reviews.Title: “Great view, pity about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: peteandrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ibis for four nights in February. At first impression hotel seemed quite good for price although reception staff did not have a good command of English. However when we got to the room, it was miniscule, with a wardrobe area about 12 inches square, very little room to hang our clothes! It was a good job we were not staying longer as we had to live out of our suitcases! However we did have a wonderful view over Darling Harbour, even though it rained quite a bit while we were there. Staff were not very helpful when requesting directions. Restaurant was very expensive and breakfast price was prohibitive! However, plenty of cafe's and restaurants in the Harbourside centre that were very reasonably priced. Would not choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: KLM105
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location admittedly but was over priced for such a shabby hotel, severe understaffing, only one lift out of three was working and the one that did had a mind of its own - took you all over the place before you got to where you were originally going. The room was dingy and small. Breakfast was expensive and pitiful. The coffee machine was broken and the bacon and eggs I couldn't eat as they'd been sitting around for so long. A much better place thats cheaper and a similar distance from the exhibition centre is the mercure near central station - great staff, excellent breakfast and really nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: itinerary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 2 minutes from the Sydney Convention & Exhibition Centre and just a short walk from Darling Harbour and Star City Casino. The Pyrmont view rooms are small and reasonably clean however I did notice that the shower either leaked or was used by the previous room occupant as there was water on the bathroom floor upon check-in. Reception staff were friendly however I did have a battle with the electronic room key at times. The TV was small however the selection on in-house movies was exceptional. I noted that the broadband cord from the wall to my laptop was only 30cms long and therefore made laptop useage very difficult. Tea and coffee is provided in the rooms and a vending machine in the lobby is very handy. There is a supermarket across the road for last minute goodies and the Harbourside Shopping Centre is 5 minutes away where there is a great food court and restaurants with great views of the city. Good hotel for overnight conference stays or short leisure visits only.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Hotel. I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia4
Reviews.Content: Had to wait ages at reception (even though it was 9pm at night) for a receptionist who could barely speak/understand english. I was told they would hold the amount on my card for the duration of my stay - I was, however, not told that that amount would be held for an extra 5 days post my paying the bill with a different card. I had to call up to find this out when my rent could not come out of my account! My towel was filthy - brown stains on a white towel. One lift was working the entire stay - which caused patrons to become very very very grumpy. The rooms were minuscule - which is absolutely pathetic for $260 a night. $260 A NIGHT! This hotel is an embarrassment for Sydney - how dare they masquerade as a decent hotel to unknowing foreigners. I would put the cleaning staff on reception and put the snooty reception staff on cleaning duty - at least the cleaners greeted you with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Run Down Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ineedabreak82
Reviews.Content: Hotel was understaffed on front desk, and reception staff spoke little english. Only one lift of 3 working the majority of stay, although I realise this is often beyond the hotel's control, there was no apology or empathy from the hotel duty manager, who exclaimed it was not his problem. The room was tiny, with hairs in the shower (good shower head though) and dust in obvious places. Terrible carparking system, poorly explained by reception (we went next door to Novotel for better information - thanks Novotel!)

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ibis Experience”
Reviews.Author: 120Rocks
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spotlessly clean, fairly modern, but very small. The rate, while somewhat lower than the next door Novotel included nothing, internet, phone, help desk and so on. Spend a few extra $ on the rate, stay at the Novotel and get a much larger room with some amenities included, like concierge and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Understaffed, but Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: A-van-the-man
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Australia, for a conference, which took place at the nearby conference center. The hotel was a disappointment though. I had to wait quite long before I could check in (not something you are hoping for after a long flight from Europe), because the hotel is understaffed. The rooms were clean, but quite small and the interior is very basic. Same for the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was okay, although again understaffed (which seems to be a long-term problem, as other reviews have also noticed). The hotel doesn't offer you much extra, no pool, etc. The location was quite convenient for me, lots of restaurants and bars in Darling Harbour and you good discover the city quite easily from this hotel. But, in the end, the price of the hotel was by far not worth the quality you get. I would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RedPuffin
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in Nov 2007, and the hotel provides exactly what you pay for. The rooms are clean, functional and small. The location for Darling Harbour is great; I didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Well its clean and the location is good I suppose”
Reviews.Author: Spoilmeplease
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms (think cabin in a caravan park). European travellers don't be fooled - the rooms should be larger in Australia. No pool - not even a bath. There was a single blanket, but only a queen bed. Understaffed hence long reception wait (so didnt appreciate being told they only had single blankets when I questioned this). Pay the extra for the view. The reception area smelt of cigarette smoke despite the non smoking sign but that could have been all the smokers outside the door. On the plus side the bed was very comfortable when we sorted out pillows and a grown up blanket. Location was great. The bathroom was clean. Airconditioner and noise wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted - ridiculously overpriced”
Reviews.Author: gracie5star
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here because a group that my husband was working with were staying here. After arriving quite late, I was disgusted to find that the room was about the size of a shoe box. It was so cramped that one side of the bed was pushed against the wall. This would not have bothered me if the room had been cheap but I paid $180 to stay. On top of that we had to pay $25 just to park the car. The bathroom was tiny - my husband and I couldnt fit in there at the same time and the entire hotel had a very moist damp smell. The only thing included in the room was tea & coffee facilities, having said that - the only place to plug the kettle in was in the bathroom. I was even more infuriated to find out the rather nice Novotel was next door and only $20 more for the night. Also, when I went to check out the next day (at the advised checkout time), there was only one staff member on reception and about 30 people waiting to check out so it took FOREVER. Will never ever stay there again - choose the Novotel pay the extra $20!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Modest, Clean, Modern Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: lwew
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was the size we expected, having stayed in other Ibis hotels. It was clean and modern. We didn't have a harbor view and were told it would be $30/night extra, so we abandoned that idea. The worst problem is that only one lift/elevator was working, so it took FOREVER to go up and down and the lifts were CRAMMED with people as everyone knew that they didn't want to wait literally 10 mins for the next one. I asked the receptionist if there was a stairwell and she replied 'No'. I prayed for no fires. We ate an evening meal and 2 breakfasts in the buffet and it was good and quite well priced in compared to some we'd encountered in Australia. The bed and pillows were of poor quality. The location was very convenient. Check out was slow. The bedroom doors are impossible to close quietly which tends to wake people up.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak38
Reviews.Content: Stayed her as a place to crash from a big night drinking Staff were all nice Rates were pretty good considering it is a big weekend I stayed with a friend in a twin room and got a complimentary upgrade to a darling harbour view which was cool but it didnt matter too much as it was just me and a friend staying. Breakfast was probably the highlight (maybe because I was still a bit hungover) but there was an abundance of food and the staff seemed pretty well intact for a sunday morning. All in All was good for a place to sleep with a mate after a big night out. the rooms were small but at least it was clean and the beds were comfortable

Reviews.Title: “$50/day "Bond" - A total Rip Off!!”
Reviews.Author: beanbagdan
Reviews.Content: Disappointing stay in a superior location. Another hotel that the website states it has had a "full refurbishment in late 2007" Where?? The walls in the corridors are all badly marked, and to my eyes the hotel is very tired looking. As I checked in behind an African gentleman, the receptionist told him that he had to pay a $350 "security deposit" on top of his room rate. He was naturally quite shocked, but I thought this was perhaps a risk management strategy for Africans. But I too got stung with a $50 per day charge as a "security deposit"...maybe their mini bar selection is just too tempting? The receptionist assured me it was just a 'hold' for this amount and not a charge, however, this money certainly DID get taken from my Debit Card account - and you would think that you would get it back on the day of departure? Oh no, it takes FIVE DAYS to do that!! Oh and is the mini bar too tempting - no chance - there isn't anything in the fridge, not even milk when I checked in. ACCOR - you have really hit the lows here!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a LOT more work to even rate as 3 star”
Reviews.Author: perfectlyperth
Reviews.Content: Firstly I will state that I gave the Accor Group 2 months to send me a feedback form. As they failed to do so â€“ I am putting my honest review here. So â€“ first complaint: The rooms no longer have a feedback for in them. Instead there is a card that you put your email address on and they promise to email you a feedback form. They never did. I requested one from their website 2 weeks ago â€“ still no feedback form. My booking was for 6 nights in February. Initially I attempted to book via the Accor website (which I have done many times before without issue) in early January. The system kept crashing after I entered credit card number. Eventually I rang their call centre and made the booking over the phone. I was told I would be upgraded to a top floor room on the harbour side â€“ on one of the newly renovated floors. I was told over the phone my credit card had been approved and debited. Upon check in I confirmed that I was definitely being put in a newly renovated room. It was confirmed that was the case. My room was 519 on 5th floor. It was May 2005 when I last stayed at the Ibis and I honestly couldnâ€™t see any difference in the look or furnishings. The room was miniscule. Nowhere to put your suitcase once it was unpacked. The doorless wardrobe was 10 to 12 inches wide and that included the space the ironing board was taking up. I hung 3 tops and 2 jeans in there and it was already overcrowded. Bathroom: tiny. Shower stall only. Rust all around the bottom joins. Two very small towels provided â€“ no bigger than hand towels â€“ thin and sandpaper-like, far from plush. When I first washed my hands the sink retained the water. I looked everywhere for a lever or knob that controlled the sink plug (which was a smooth silver circle). Eventually I rang reception and asked for assistance. They said they would send somebody up immediately. 30 minutes later I rang again. They stated they could get it fixed the next day. I advised I wanted to use the sink that night. Eventually someone came up at 11.35pm. He plunged his hands into the dirty soapy water and twisted and twisted the silver circle until it came undone. He advised it was a â€œnew style plugâ€�. TV: No complimentary TV stations â€“ just the free to air ABC, SBS, 7, 9 & 10. No volume control available so you could barely hear it. TV was a flat screen wall mounted LCD approx 14 inches wide (my laptop is bigger!). It was viewable only when sitting in one position on the bed. It could not be seen from anywhere else in the room. No security lock or chain on the door so if you succeeded in sleeping through housekeeping knocking on your door (or if you were in the shower â€“ with the bathroom door open due to lack of ventilation), housekeeping were able to stroll right on in. The door frame was crooked (or else the door had way too many coats of paint) and needed a good elbowing to open it. Judging by the sounds up and down the hallway - everyone had the same problem. The â€œdo not disturbâ€� door signs do not actually say â€œdo not disturbâ€�. Just to be different they say â€œshhhhh I am sleepingâ€�. This advice however did not stop housekeeping from banging down your door every 30 minutes from 8.30am onwards. Even when I got a texta and wrote â€œI really truly am sleeping PLEASE DO NOT DISTURBâ€� â€“ they still knocked. Bedding: Pillows were the $2 variety from a market stall. Soft and so floppy it took four of them to get my head 2 inches from the mattress. I noticed a tiny smudge of what appeared to be old hair dye on one of the spare pillows upon checkin. At the end of the week that same pillow case was still there. I gathered my sheets and pillow cases had not been laundered at all in 7 days. Curtains: I had a view of Darling Harbour â€“ which also meant I faced the rising sun. The curtains were simply 2 woven mat screens to pull across. My photos show that the city lights (and the rising sun) blazed through them. I mentioned this on several occasions to the front desk. I first asked if I could swap to a Pyrmont view room but the hotel was fully booked. I next asked if could get a blanket to peg up across the window. I was told there were no spare blankets. (Linen supply was clearly an issue as three days in a row I had to ring and ask for face clothes and towels as mine had been removed but not replaced!). Finally on day 5 I yet again mentioned to reception (when they asked how my stay was going) that I had not slept all week due to the lights and sun. The guy said â€œoh havenâ€™t you found the secret hidden rubber curtain yet â€“ all the rooms on that side have one. You should have been shown how to find it when you checked in.â€� Dâ€™oh ??????? Why on earth would you have a curtain that is secret and hidden ??? So he advised he would send housekeeping up to help me out with the curtain. About 4 hours later housekeeping knocked on the door. A shy smiling man stood there and handed me a small box. I wondered if it was a special key or remote to would reveal the secret location of the curtain. I asked him if he was here to help me with the curtain. He nodded and pointed to the box and said â€œcurtainâ€�. I opened the box and found 3 cotton buds (Q tips to some). I said â€œNo â€“ I need help with the curtainâ€�, pointing to the window. He nodded and smiled and pointed to the box again and said â€œcurtainâ€�. I smiled, said thanks and closed the door. Something tells me there is somewhat a gaping hole in the language barrier between the indian reception desk clerk and the Mauritian housekeeping that would never get beyond the difference between CURTAIN and COTTON ! After much searching and climbing on not so secure looking desk tops, I finally located a chain hiding behind a lip in the window frame, tugging it revealed a rubber curtain that did indeed block out the sun. My suggestion to the Ibis â€“ put a freaking sign on the desk that tells people about the â€œsecret hidden curtainâ€�. Also on day 5 of my stay I received a message under my door that stated my credit card booking had not been processed in January when I made my phone booking as their computers had been down. At no time in the next 5 weeks did they attempt to contact me by phone, email or mail (all provided with the booking), and at no time did they bother to re-input my transaction. Very unimpressed. Breakfast: is not included in your room price. Itâ€™s an exorbitant $17 extra. To say it was a standard buffet breakfast would be insulting to all the standard breakfast buffets out there in the world. The hot food was stodgy and cold â€“ if there was any. Most of the baine maries were empty. People were knocking on the kitchen doors asking for refills. Finding staff was basically impossible. The coffee/tea machine had so many knobs and buttons and controls you needed a pilots license to operate it. People stood and stared at it before again knocking on the kitchen door and demanding assistance. Honestly â€“ my suggestion is head out the back doors and walk along to the monorail station where you will find an elevator down to Harbourside shopping mall. Head to the food hall. Plenty of breakfast choices including Gloria Jeans. All more filling and cheaper than the Ibis. Broadband (not wireless): As with so many Australian hotels (who lag behind the entire world in this regard) the cost is ridiculous. 50cents per minute or $27.50 per day. When you consider the average person pays that per month â€“ I cannot fathom how hotels are permitted to charge this per day. Its overpriced for its quality (or lack there of). Itâ€™s a 2 star pretending to be a 3 star but charging the same as the infinitely better quality 5 star Star City around the corner. You are paying for its location and thatâ€™s all. Its convenient to Pyrmont, Star City, Darling Harbour, the monorail, and Harbourside shops. Would I stay here again ? Probably only for 2 or 3 day stays. Not for a week again. Especially without the benefit of room service.

Reviews.Title: “Tired & dingy Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Swarovski
Reviews.Content: Although this Hotel is close to the Convention Centre in Darling Harbour it is more like a back packers hotel. The entrance foyer is so outdated and the corridors are dark and dingy. The hotel rooms are also small for the price paid. My room had a very noisy bar fridge if you call it a bar fridge at all. There were 3 tiny Long Life milk containers in it!! I got up during the night and turned it off so I could get some sleep. The hotel room smelled of cigarettes even though I had asked for a non-smoking room. Don't even stay for breakfast - there are cheaper and better restaurants on the waterfront. I queried the price of my room after hearing on checkout someone getting a cheaper rate. I definitely would not bother staying here ever again. This hotel needs a huge revamp immediately.

Reviews.Title: “The heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Alpinekaren
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Darling Harbor Has a great location! Although we did not have a room with a view and the rooms are not large, they are comparable in size to many hotels that we have visited in Europe. We did not really find this to be a problem considering the room rates are very good and the location is superb my husband and I would definitely recommend it. We spent most of our wonderful 4 days exploring Sydney, which was sadly just not enough. We will return to the Ibis at the end of our trip around Australia, and hopefully have some more time to spend in wonderful Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Sample life in a cell”
Reviews.Author: TheSoutherner
Reviews.Content: If you would like to experience life in a cell then you can't go far wrong by staying at the Ibis at Darling Harbour. The rooms are tiny, the beds are made for midgets and the furnishings are meagre. The doors seem to be on sprung hinges so that every time a cell mate enters or leaves their room the noise of the banging door reverberates around the hotel ensuring that everyone has a sleepless night. This is quite simply the worst hotel I have stayed in - its only saving grace being that it's central and alongside the attractive Darling Harbour. But believe me, that's the only thing going for this prison-style establishment which is over-priced and totally lacking in character.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: rdv
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel for a 4 night stay at the end of a 6 week holiday. The room was by far the smallest we have ever stayed in.The location and view make up for it and at Â£120 a night you wont beat it. The staff were helpful and friendly and the room although basic was clean. Would stay here again for that view.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location....”
Reviews.Author: Nicky-ps
Reviews.Content: If location is high on your 'must have' list for a hotel room, then this place is right up there! The location is fantastic for any traveller who only has a few days to explore Sydney, as it is walking distance to so many attractions/sights and modes of transport. No the rooms aren't big, they are however very clean and have all the necassary amenities for a comfortable stay (tea & coffee facilities, fridge, iron, tv). The view of Darling Harbour from the 'Harbour View Rooms' is definately worth forking our a little extra for...

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: wales_UKSarah
Reviews.Content: We arrive at the airport and got a bus directly to the hotel which was great. The rooms were a little small, but i did not come to sydney to stay in my room!. The view was excellent, had a great view of darling harbour well worth requesting. The hotel was good value for money and good location. The City tour bus ( connection to Bondi Beach at the station) stopped 5 mins away. When we arrived the harbour had its xmas celebrations and we had a lovely view. Plenty of places to eat around the harbour & the Imax cinema is a must. City shopping area about 15mins walk and boat trip frequently leaving for sidney harbour & the opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but basic.”
Reviews.Author: jbushie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for a family holiday. Having said that, all of those we saw checking in or out were senior citizens and the English one in the next room was the first to demonstrate the paper-thin walls, waking us early every morning as he remonstrated with his wife. Somehow, our booking had been lost as a 'no-show' (possibly not the hotel's fault) and was happily rectified with an upgrade from a suburban (Pyrmont) view room to a harbour view one. Staff at the front desk were always helpful, but seemed undermanned... there was always a queue. Otherwise, the rooms were basic and not overly spacious. The bathroom was well appointed, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The small fridge (unstocked) lacked a freezer compartment which we would have used to freeze drink bottles every night in the humid weather of Spring. The buffet breakfast was limited but good, and as the only option in the downstairs cafe was somewhat overpriced at $17.50. The in-room internet was outrageously priced at $0.50 a minute, but there were three cheaper public computers in the foyer. There is an airport minibus that stops at the hotel ($12/head) and a minimart across the road. The view and the hotel's walking proximity to the CBD, ferry stops, monorail and Darling Harbour attractions are it's selling points. If you plan to be out most of the day, then this is a reasonable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ive stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pollyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. The rooms are small and dirty and I felt like I was in a prison. Very basic and for the money you can get much better deals in Sydney. Try The Metro on Pitt. Will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great base.”
Reviews.Author: mizz
Reviews.Content: I was a bit scared of staying here after reading some remarks, But my boyfriend and myself found it really good. OK the rooms arn't the biggest but hotel rooms in big cities usually are not on the large side, but they're functional and very clean. We had a nice view of Darling Harbour and the breakfast in the morning was great loads of choice there. I thought it was a great base to get around Sydney, and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ainsworth179
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad press on here we were very apprehensive about staying here. The hotel had a makeover recently and some floors were still being finished off. For the money, this hotel is fantastic value. Darling Harbour is a great area in which to base yourself to see Sydney. The monorail and ferries ensure it is well connected to the CBD. For Â£70 a night you're not going to get absolute luxury - after all ,we didn't travel all that way to stay in a hotel room for 10 days. the room was small but it had everything we needed. Do stay here - it's not as bad as the reviews would have you believe.

Reviews.Title: “Makes a good tourist base.”
Reviews.Author: kosc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis for a few days midweek. You certainly pay for the view- the room was tiny, but for the amount of time we spent there it was fine. And what a view! We were on the 9th floor so nothing obstructed the cityscape and the harbour. The rooms on the other side have a view of Pyrmont. The room was clean and freshly renovated. Our waiter (Willis?) was lovely. On the downside only one out of three elevators worked while we were there, front desk staff were rude (not a big surprise) and the tiny flatscreen TV was mounted so high you couldn't make out the picture unless you were standing. On the whole a pretty ordinary hotel but a fantastic location and even better view.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, like a motel in the city cente”
Reviews.Author: kitta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis for 2 nights while attending a conference at Darling Harbour and found it good value for money. Yes, it was fairly basic and the room was small but it is perfect for value conscious single travellers and couples who are out most of the day. The room was clean but the shower was the smallest I have seen in for a while. I stayed in a harbour view room and think that this made a huge difference - I had a great view on the 4th floor of the city of Sydney and it is easy to get into the city on foot or monorail. The walk to Sydney harbour is only about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice from the outside.....”
Reviews.Author: alphabetty
Reviews.Content: Looks nice from the outside, and the lobby is nice....but the hotel is TERRIBLE inside. The room was dirty. 2 people staying, one face cloth. The shower had mold in the grout on the side and the floor, the thing reminded me of a glorified motel 6. Asked for a room with a view of the harbor, got a room with the view of 7-11 across the street. 3 pay internet computer terminals in the lobby which were always full, even at 7 in the morning. Don't waste your time! Pay a little more and get something better!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, Avoid, Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Highlancer
Reviews.Content: Please just look elsewhere. But if you need convincing.... I was on business in Sydney and trying to keep the costs down so I chose the Ibis since it was in a decent location. And it is a good location, but that's where the good points end and the rest quickly degrades from there. The room reminded me a lot of the cells that I visited in alcatraz, small, narrow and confined. Amenities just don't even come in play here, your talking a bed (small and hard), a tv and a bathroom. Bathroom was really, really small and shower had the mold factor going on. The hallways feel like your in a rent-by-the-hour hotel. The breakfast area and breakfast itself were average. The rest just felt VERY run down and VERy cheap. I moved to the Swissotel after enduring a night at the Ibis. WOW, talk about money well spent and it wasn't that much more than the Ibis! Just please avoid having to come back here and write your story of disappointment about the Ibis. Sydney is much too nice of a destination to have it spoiled by a bad hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ell33
Reviews.Content: What can you really say about the Ibis? I've stayed at many Ibis hotels in the UK and Europe and they all provide the same basic accommodation you come to expect. This one is no different. A small lobby with a bar a few paces away. Friendly staff, even though they were clearly under pressure on the morning we checked out. The room we stayed in was on the tenth floor, but our view wasn't the best as we faced onto the street to the front of the hotel. The rear faces onto Darling Harbour and I'd imagine the view from those rooms would be tremendous. The room itself was small with two single beds. An absolutely tiny wardrobe area which could only hold about four hangers. Needless to say our suitcase remained packed for the 5 days we were there! The bathroom was also small. Breakfast was available, but we didn't use these facilities as Darling Harbour is only a two minute walk away and provide plenty of options for eating. The location of this hotel made up for it's basic facilities. Darling Harbour is a fantastic area. It's full of bars and restaurants and has a ferry terminal which takes you to the bridge and opera house. At night it's beautiful with the lights of the skyscrapers and around the bay turned on. The hotel is easy to get to too. From either the domestic or international airports a train connects to Sydney Central. A tram then connects you to the Convention Centre which is directly at the rear of the hotel. Transfer from airport to check in took about 50 minutes. All in all a basic hotel with the advantage of a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out 10 minutes after checking in”
Reviews.Author: PetesBodyParts
Reviews.Content: Was booked to stay at the IBIS, Darling Harbour for two nights as part of a business trip. I should have gone with my instinct at the reception desk when they could'nt find my booking and received no apology once they found it. Once I exited the elevator on level 9, the first thing that hit me was the smell of cooked meat! I was in for a bigger shock when I opened by room door and the smell of damp carpet and cigarette smoke (for a room with a large no smoking sign on the door, this was not a good start). I then discovered that the toilet had paper in it and that there was a large damp patch on the carpet. I rang reception and explained that it was unacceptable and wished to be moved to another room and was told (with no apology) that the hotel was full, so my choices were limited. I unpacked, then called a friend and decided to move to his hotel. I grabbed the phone book to call the other hotel and then discovered it was mouldy from damp! At reception I advised them I was leaving and I was told I still had to pay for the room for the night! To add insult to injury, I asked for a cab to be called and was told that they pass the hotel all the time! At this stage, I was willing (and did) pay for the other hotel from my own money - if that is not an indicator of a bad hotel, then I don't know what is. If you are after a room that should rent by the hour, then this will please you no end. If you are looking for a hotel that welcomes it's guests and listens to their concerns, then try the Holiday Inn in Darling Harbour, or the Sheraton on the Park in Elizabeth Street (my favourite for treating their guests like royalty)

Reviews.Title: “Average, considering the location”
Reviews.Author: blober0
Reviews.Content: Our check-in was probably the worst part of our 3-day stay, so that is part of why I put average. We checked in Jan 2nd, post-NYE to get the cheaper rates. We even checked in fairly late in the evening, and still ran into issues at check-in... There was quite a wait to even get a clean room (others were also waiting in the lobby with us to get one), and then we went to the room assigned and it smelled AWFUL! They are smaller rooms, so it was fairly evident that someone had vomited in the room/bathroom over NYE, and they were still cleaning up two days later.... The smell was so overwhelming that we requested a new room, even if it meant waiting all over again! The other party that was waiting for a room when we checked in was still there, and finally left for another hotel because they were so fed up with waiting. THey gave us another room, in which we found someone else's complimentary honeymoon bottle of champagne, and had to call the front desk to make sure they didn't give us some poor honeymooners' room!! After the first night, everything settled down and we had an enjoyable stay. Rooms are small, and some have good views (we had to give up our good view to get rid of the vomit room...boo!) but the hotel seemed "average" to me, considering where it was located within Sydney. I have to give the staff credit for taking care of all our issues, albeit slowly. One poor front-desk gentleman had been there for 14 hours without any breaks, and still went out of his way to help get people checked into the rooms. Hope you check-in is better than ours!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdamV
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. The size of the room is very much suitable for 2, but deluxe for 1 person. There is one chair in the room, with a desk, telephone/alarm clock/radio and lamps on each side of the bed. Light swiches for the main ceiling light are located next to the room door, and on one side of the bed. A kettle is supplied, as well as tea, coffee, sugar and milk. Windows are not open-able, but the rooms have air conditioning, with a swich where the room temperature can be set. The television has 6 channels: 7, 9, 10, ABC, SBS and a Tourist Channel. Pay per view movies are available for $14.95 each as well as 4 adult channels. The bathroom has a small shower, with a clothesline which is placeable between the walls of the shower. There is also a regular sized sink and a hair dryer. A small fridge that is empty (no mini-bar when I stayed there) is located under the TV. Then the usual you would expect from a hotel: About 5 towels of different sizes, 2 small bars of good quality soap, 1 packet of shampoo, 1 packet of conditioner, shower cap and a sanitary bag. An iron and a large ironing board are also supplied as well as an extra blanket. I loved this hotel and I would definately stay in it again in the future.
